  4602                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4603                                  
  4604                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4605                                  
  4606                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4607                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4608                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4609                                  
  4610                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4611                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4612                                  		;=============================================================
  4613                                  		;
  4614                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4615                                  		;
  4616                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4617                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4618                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4619                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4620                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4621                                  
  4622                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4623                                  		;=============================================================
  4624                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4625                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4626                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4627                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4628                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4629                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4630                                  
  4631                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4632                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4633                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4634                                  		
  4635                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4636                                  		;cli	; not necessary at this stage
  4637                                  
  4638                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4639                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4640                                  		;push	ax
  4641                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4642                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4643                                  		;pop	ax
  4644                                  	
  4645                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4646                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4647                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4648                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4649                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4650                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4651                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4652                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4653                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4654                                  
  4655                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4656                                  
  4657                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4658                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4659                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4660                                  
  4661 00001766 2EA3[C416]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4662 0000176A 2E891E[C216]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4663                                  
  4664                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4665                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4666                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4667                                  
  4668 0000176F 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4669 00001770 07                      		pop	es
  4670                                  
  4671 00001771 51                      		push	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4672                                  		;push	di ; *! (not necessary) ; 13/12/2023
  4673                                  
  4674                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4675                                  		; ds <> cs
  4676                                  		; ds = relocated MSLOAD segment, cs = BIOSDATA segment
  4677                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4678                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4679                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4680                                  		; ds = cs
  4681 00001772 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4682 00001774 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4683                                  		; ds = 0
  4684                                  
  4685 00001776 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4686                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4687                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4688                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4689 00001778 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4690                                  		
  4691                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4692 0000177B FA                      		cli
  4693                                  next_int_:		
  4694 0000177C 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4695 0000177D AC                      		lodsb		
  4696                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4697 0000177E 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4698 0000177F D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4699 00001781 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4700 00001783 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4701 00001785 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4702                                  					; saving address in di
  4703                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4704                                  		;stosw
  4705                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4706                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4707                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4708 00001787 A5                      		movsw
  4709 00001788 A5                      		movsw
  4710                                  
  4711 00001789 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4712 0000178B E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4713                                  
  4714                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4715                                  		;pop	di  ; *!
  4716                                  		;pop	cx ; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4717                                  
  4718                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4719                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4720                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4721                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4722                                  
  4723                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4724                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4725                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4726                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4727                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4728                                  
  4729                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4730 0000178D C7064C00[6B07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4731                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4732                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4733 00001793 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4734                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4735 00001797 C7065400[3F08]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4736                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4737                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4738 0000179D 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4739                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4740 000017A1 C7066400[F007]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4741                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4742                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4743 000017A7 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4744                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4745                                  
  4746                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4747 000017AB 0E                      		push	cs
  4748 000017AC 1F                      		pop	ds
  4749                                  		
  4750 000017AD A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4751 000017B0 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4752 000017B3 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4753 000017B6 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4754                                  					; ;
  4755 000017B9 FB                      		sti
  4756 000017BA CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4757                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4758                                  
  4759                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4760                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4761                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4762                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4763                                  ;
  4764                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4765                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4766                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4767                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4768                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4769                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4770                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4771                                  
  4772                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4773                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4774                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4775                                  ;
  4776                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4777                                  ; to do anything special.
  4778                                  ;
  4779                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4780                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4781                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4782                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4783                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4784                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4785                                  
  4786                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4787 000017BC A801                    		test	al, 1
  4788                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4789 000017BE 7524                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4790                                  
  4791                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4792                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4793                                  ;
  4794                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4795                                  ;
  4796                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4797                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4798                                  
  4799                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4800                                  		; ((cx is already on top of the stack))
  4801                                  		;push	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4802                                  		;push	bx	; not necessary
  4803 000017C0 50                      		push	ax
  4804 000017C1 52                      		push	dx
  4805                                  		;push	di	; not necessary
  4806 000017C2 06                      		push	es
  4807                                  
  4808 000017C3 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4809 000017C5 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4810 000017C7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4811                                  					; DL = drive number
  4812                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4813                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4814                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4815 000017C9 7204                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4816                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4817                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4818                                  		; ds = cs
  4819 000017CB 8816[6517]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4820                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4821                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4822 000017CF 07                      		pop	es
  4823                                  		;pop	di
  4824 000017D0 5A                      		pop	dx
  4825 000017D1 58                      		pop	ax
  4826                                  		;pop	bx
  4827                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4828                                  		;pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4829 000017D2 7210                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  4830                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4831                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4832                                  
  4833                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4834                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4835                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4836                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4837 000017D4 A0[6517]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4838 000017D7 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4839 000017D9 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4840                                  
  4841                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4842                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4843 000017DB 48                      		dec	ax
  4844 000017DC EB0A                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4845                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4846                                  
  4847                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4848                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4849                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4850                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4851 000017DE 40                      		inc	ax ; al = 1
  4852 000017DF A2[D516]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4853                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4854                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4855                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4856 000017E2 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4857                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4858                                  
  4859                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4860 000017E4 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4861 000017E6 D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4862                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4863                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4864                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4865 000017E8 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4866 000017EA 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4867 000017EC 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4868                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4869                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4870                                  		; ds = cs
  4871 000017ED FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4872                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4873                                  notsingle:				
  4874 000017F1 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4875                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4876                                  					; booted off hard file
  4877                                  		; 13/12/2023
  4878 000017F2 59                      		pop	cx	; +++ ; ch = [MediaByte]
  4879                                  
  4880 000017F3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4881                                  
  4882                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4883                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4884                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4885                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4886                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4887                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4888                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4889                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4890                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4891                                  
  4892                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4893                                  
  4894 000017F5 F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4895 000017F8 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4896 000017FA 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4897                                  gothrd:					
  4898                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  4899                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4900                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4901                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4902                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  4903                                  
  4904                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4905                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h (from MSLOAD)
  4906                                  		;cli
  4907                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4908                                  		;mov	sp, 700h

  5284                                  
  5285                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5286                                  ; diskette drives:
  5287                                  ;
  5288                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5289                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5290                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5291                                  ;
  5292                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5293                                  ;
  5294                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5295                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5296                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5297                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5298                                  					
  5299 00001998 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl

  5308                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5309                                  
  5310                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5311                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5312                                  
  5313                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5314                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5315                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5316                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5317                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5318                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5319                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5320                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5321                                  
  5322 000019A2 803E[D516]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  5323 000019A7 750B                    		jnz	short loop_drive
  5324 000019A9 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5325                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5326 000019AB 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5327                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5328 000019AD C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; set end of link
  5329 000019B1 E90801                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives

  5331                                  
  5332                                  loop_drive:

  5340                                  		;xor	cx, cx		; zero all flags

  5343                                  					; get next bds

  5345                                  					; set form factor to 48	tpi

  5361                                  					; DL = drive number
  5362                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5363                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5370 000019D1 E98000                  		jmp	noparmsfromrom

  5372                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  5373                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5374                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5375                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5376                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5377                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.
  5378                                  
  5379                                  chk_pfr:
  5380 000019D4 80FD00                  		cmp	ch, 0		; if ch=0, then	cl,dh=0	too.
  5381 000019D7 7505                    		jnz	short pfr_ok

  5383                                  		;mov	cl, 9		; let's default to 360k.

  5424                                  		; (this is also a ROMBIOS bug, some ROMBIOSs return number

  5751                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5752                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5753                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5754                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5755                                  ;
  5756                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5757                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5758                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5759                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5760                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5761                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5762                                  ;******************************************************************************

  5774                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5775                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5776                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5777                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5778                                  ;
  5779                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5780                                  ;
  5781                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5782                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5783                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5784                                  ;use to start with.
  5785                                  ;
  5786                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5787                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5788                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5789                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5790                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.

  5875                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5876                                  ;
  5877                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5878                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5879                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5880                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5881                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5882                                  ; off of it.
  5883                                  ;
  5884                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5885                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5886                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5887                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  6129 00001C21 891E[CE16]              		mov	[md_sectorsize], bx ; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  6130 00001C25 268A5D1F                		mov	bl, [es:di+1Fh]	; [di+BDS.fatsiz]
  6131                                  					; get size of fat on media
  6132 00001C29 881E[C816]              		mov	[fbigfat], bl
  6133 00001C2D 268A4D08                		mov	cl, [es:di+8]
  6134 00001C31 268B4517                		mov	ax, [es:di+17h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS]
  6135 00001C35 2906[C216]              		sub	[bios_l], ax	; subtract hidden sectors since we
  6136                                  					; need a logical sector number that will
  6137                                  					; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)
  6138 00001C39 268B4519                		mov	ax, [es:di+19h] ; [di+BDS.BDS_BPB.BPB_HIDDENSECTORS+2]
  6139 00001C3D 1906[C416]              		sbb	[bios_h], ax	; subtract upper 16 bits of sector num
  6140                                  	; ------
  6141                                  
  6142 00001C41 30ED                    		xor	ch, ch	 ; cx = sectors/cluster
  6143                                  
  6144                                  	; the boot program has left the directory at 0:500h
  6145                                  
  6146 00001C43 1E                      		push	ds
  6147 00001C44 31FF                    		xor	di, di
  6148 00001C46 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6149 00001C48 8B1E3A05                		mov	bx, [53Ah]
  6150                                  		;mov	bx, ds:53Ah	; clus=*53Ah
  6151                                  					; (First cluster field of 2nd dir entry
  6152                                  					; of root directory in the buffer at 500h)
  6153 00001C4C 1F                      		pop	ds
  6154                                  loadit:
  6155 00001C4D B84504                  		mov	ax, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6156                                  		;mov	ax, 46Dh	; sysinit segment
  6157 00001C50 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6158 00001C52 268E06[7102]            		mov	es, [es:CURRENTDOSLOCATION] ; 09/12/2022
  6159                                  		;mov	es, [es:271h]
  6160                                  
  6161 00001C57 E86E06                  		call	getclus		; read cluster at ES:DI (DI is updated)
  6162                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6163                                  ;iseof:
  6164                                  		;;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], fbig
  6165                                  		;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h ; fbig
  6166                                  		; 12/12/2023
  6167                                  		; ds = cs
  6168 00001C5A F606[C816]40            		test	byte [fbigfat], 40h ; fbig
  6169 00001C5F 7506                    		jnz	short eofbig
  6170 00001C61 81FBF70F                		cmp	bx, 0FF7h
  6171 00001C65 EB03                    		jmp	short iseofx
  6172                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6173

  6176                                  iseofx:

  6178 00001C6C E8BD03                  		call	setdrvparms	; 
  6179

  6181                                  		;jmp	far 46Dh:267h
  6182 00001C6F EA[6702]4504            		jmp	SYSINITSEG:SYSINITSTART

  6184                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  6185                                  
  6186                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  6187                                  ;
  6188                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  6189                                  
  6190                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6191                                  
  6192                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6193                                  ; module name: remap
  6194                                  ;
  6195                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6196                                  ;
  6197                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6198                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6199                                  ;
  6200                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6201                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6202                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6203                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6204                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6205                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6206                                  
  6207                                  ; input:       none
  6208                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6209                                  ; exit error:  none
  6210                                  ; called from: msinit
  6211                                  ;
  6212                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6213                                  ;	  found in the system
  6214                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6215                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6216                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6217                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6218                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6219                                  ;
  6220                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6221                                  
  6222                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6223                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6224                                  
  6225                                  remap:		; proc near
  6226                                  
  6227                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6228                                  		; ds = cs
  6229                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6230 00001C74 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]
  6231                                  
  6232                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6233                                  
  6234                                  drive_loop:
  6235 00001C78 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6236                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6237 00001C7C 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6238 00001C7E 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6239                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6240 00001C80 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1 ; 0FFFFh	; last bds?
  6241 00001C83 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6242 00001C85 EB49                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6243                                  
  6244                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6245                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6246                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6247                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6248                                  
  6249                                  fdrv_found:
  6250 00001C87 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6251                                  fdrv_loop:
  6252 00001C89 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6253 00001C8C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6254                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6255                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6256                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6257 00001C8E 40                      		inc	ax
  6258 00001C8F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  6259 00001C92 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  6260                                  
  6261                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6262                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6263                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6264                                  ; any more.
  6265                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6266                                  
  6267                                  		;mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6268                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6269 00001C94 8B3E[1901]              		mov	di, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  6270 00001C98 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6271                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6272                                  		;mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6273 00001C9A 8A26[2501]              		mov	ah, [dsktnum]
  6274 00001C9E 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6275                                  remap_loop1:
  6276 00001CA1 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6277                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6278 00001CA3 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6279 00001CA6 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6280 00001CA8 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  6281 00001CAA 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6282                                  
  6283                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6284                                  
  6285                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6286                                  		;mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6287 00001CAC A0[C016]                		mov	al, [drvfat]
  6288 00001CAF 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6289 00001CB1 721D                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6290                                  		;sub	al, [cs:dsktnum]
  6291 00001CB3 2A06[2501]              		sub	al, [dsktnum]	; is it one of the other floppies?
  6292 00001CB7 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6293                                  
  6294                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6295                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6296                                  
  6297 00001CB9 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6298 00001CBB EB04                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6299                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6300                                  
  6301                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6302                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6303                                  
  6304                                  remap_boot_flop:
  6305                                  		;add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6306                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6307 00001CBD 0206[7500]              		add	al, [drvmax]
  6308                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6309                                  		;mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6310 00001CC1 A2[C016]                		mov	[drvfat], al
  6311 00001CC4 FEC0                    		inc	al
  6312 00001CC6 1E                      		push	ds
  6313 00001CC7 BF4504                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6314                                  		;mov	di, 544h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6315                                  		;;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6316 00001CCA 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6317 00001CCC A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6318                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6319                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6320 00001CCF 1F                      		pop	ds ; ds = cs
  6321                                  rmap_exit:
  6322 00001CD0 C3                      		retn
  6323                                  
  6324                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6325                                  
  6326                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6327                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6328                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6329                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6330                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6331                                  ;**************************************************
  6332                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6333                                  ;
  6334                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6335                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6336                                  ;
  6337                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6338                                  ;**************************************************
  6339                                  
  6340                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6341                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6342                                  
  6343                                  getboot:	; proc near
  6344                                  		
  6345                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6346                                  		; ds = cs
  6347                                  		
  6348                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6349                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6350                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6351                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6352                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6353                                  
  6354                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6355                                  		; 15/12/2023
  6356 00001CD1 A1[CB16]                		mov	ax, [init_bootseg]
  6357 00001CD4 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6358                                  
  6359                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6360 00001CD6 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6361                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6362                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6363 00001CD9 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6364 00001CDC 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6365 00001CDE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6366 00001CE1 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6367                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6368                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6369                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6370 00001CE3 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6371                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6372 00001CE5 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6373                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6374                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6375 00001CEC 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6376                                  erret:
  6377 00001CEE F9                      		stc
  6378                                  norm_ret:
  6379 00001CEF C3                      		retn
  6380                                  
  6381                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6382                                  		
  6383                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
  6384                                  
  6385                                  chk_partition_type:
  6386                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6387 00001CF0 268A07                  		mov	al, [es:bx]	; partition type
  6388                                  
  6389                                  		; see if partitiontype == 1, 4, 6
  6390 00001CF3 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; FAT12
  6391 00001CF5 7406                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  6392 00001CF7 3C04                    		cmp	al, 4		; FAT16 CHS (<= 32MB)
  6393 00001CF9 7402                    		je	short chk_ptype_retn
  6394 00001CFB 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; FAT16 BIG CHS (> 32MB)
  6395                                  chk_ptype_retn:
  6396                                  		; zf = 1 -> primary DOS partition
  6397                                  		; zf = 0 -> not a primary DOS partition
  6398 00001CFD C3                      		retn
  6399                                  
  6400                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6401                                  
  6402                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6403                                  
  6404                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6405                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6406                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6407                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6408                                  ;   determine version number
  6409                                  ;
  6410                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6411                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6412                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6413                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6414                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6415                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6416                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6417                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6418                                  
  6419                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6420                                  		; 16/12/2023
  6421                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6422                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6423 00001CFE 57                      		push	di
  6424 00001CFF 53                      		push	bx
  6425                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 14/08/2023
  6426 00001D00 06                      		push	es
  6427 00001D01 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6428 00001D04 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6429 00001D07 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6430                                  					; fnon_removable
  6431 00001D0B C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6432                                  					; ffHardFile
  6433 00001D0F C606[C816]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6434 00001D14 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6435 00001D16 52                      		push	dx
  6436 00001D17 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6437 00001D19 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6438                                  					; DL = drive number
  6439                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6440                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6441                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6442 00001D1B FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6443 00001D1D 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6444 00001D20 5A                      		pop	dx
  6445 00001D21 7249                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6446 00001D23 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6447 00001D26 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6448 00001D29 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6449 00001D2A E8A4FF                  		call	getboot
  6450 00001D2D 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6451 00001D2E 723C                    		jb	short setret
  6452 00001D30 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6453                                  
  6454                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6455                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6456                                  
  6457                                  act_part:
  6458 00001D33 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6459 00001D38 740B                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6460                                  ; 16/12/2023
  6461                                  %if 0
  6462                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6463                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  6464                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6465                                  		jz	short got_good_act
  6466                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6467                                  		jnz	short no_act
  6468                                  %endif
  6469                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
  6470                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  6471                                  
  6472 00001D3A E8B3FF                  		call	chk_partition_type
  6473 00001D3D 7506                    		jne	short no_act
  6474                                  
  6475                                  got_good_act:
  6476 00001D3F 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6477 00001D41 742D                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6478 00001D43 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6479                                  no_act:
  6480 00001D45 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6481 00001D48 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6482                                  					; last entry done?
  6483 00001D4C 75E5                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6484 00001D4E BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6485                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6486                                  
  6487                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6488                                  
  6489                                  get_primary:				
  6490 00001D51 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6491 00001D56 750B                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6492                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6493                                  ; 16/12/2023
  6494                                  %if 0
  6495                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6496                                  		jz	short got_prim
  6497                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6498                                  		jz	short got_prim
  6499                                  		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6500                                  		jnz	short not_prim
  6501                                  %endif
  6502                                  		; 16/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
  6503                                  		; check if it is a primary dos partition
  6504                                  
  6505 00001D58 E895FF                  		call	chk_partition_type
  6506 00001D5B 7506                    		jne	short not_prim
  6507                                  
  6508                                  got_prim:
  6509 00001D5D 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6510 00001D5F 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6511 00001D61 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6512                                  not_prim:
  6513 00001D63 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6514 00001D66 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6515 00001D6A 75E5                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6516                                  setret:					
  6517 00001D6C F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6518 00001D6D E98502                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6519                                  
  6520                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6521                                  
  6522                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6523                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6524                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6525                                  ;
  6526                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6527                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6528                                  ;  without change.
  6529                                  ;
  6530                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6531                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6532                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6533                                  
  6534                                  set2:
  6535                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6536                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6537 00001D70 8816[CD16]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6538                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl

  7000                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7002                                  ; ****** cas ---
  7003                                  ; IBM DOS 3.30 doesn't seem to mind that the TOTAL_SECTORS and
  7004                                  ; BIG_TOTAL_SECTORS field in the boot sector are 0000. This
  7005                                  ; happens with some frequency -- perhaps through some OS/2 setup
  7006                                  ; program. We haven't actually been COPYING the TOTAL_SECTORS
  7007                                  ; from the boot sector into the DPB anyway, we've just been using
  7008                                  ; it for calculating the fat size. Pretty scary, huh? For now,
  7009                                  ; we'll go ahead and copy it into the DPB, except in the case
  7010                                  ; that it equals zero, in which case we just use the values in
  7011                                  ; the DPB from the partition table.
  7012                                  
  7013                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7014                                  ;MOVMEDIAIDS equ mov_media_ids - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (751h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7015                                  ;CLEARIDS equ clear_ids - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (5D9h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)		    		
  7016                                  ; 09/12/2022

  7197                                  scan:

  7210                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7211                                  
  7212                                  gotparm:				
  7213 00001F5F 8A4C08                  		mov	cl, [si+8]	; fat size for fbigfat flag
  7214                                  		;or	ds:fbigfat, cl
  7215                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7216 00001F62 080E[C816]              		or	[fbigfat], cl	; (fbig flag, 40h or 0) ; 08/08/2023

  7218                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  7219 00001F66 8B4C04                  		mov	cx, [si+4]
  7220                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:si+4]	; ch = number of sectors per cluster
  7221                                  					; cl = log base 2 of ch
  7222 00001F69 8B5406                  		mov	dx, [si+6]
  7223                                  		;mov	dx, [cs:si+6]	; dx = number of root dir entries
  7224                                  
  7225                                  ; now calculate size of fat table
  7226                                  
  7227 00001F6C 89550C                  		mov	[di+0Ch], dx	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  7228                                  					; save number of (root)	dir entries
  7229 00001F6F 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]

  7232                                  					; save sectors per cluster
  7233                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7234 00001F78 F606[C816]40            		test	byte [fbigfat], 40h
  7235                                  		;test	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  7236                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  7237 00001F7D 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  7238                                  
  7239                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  7240                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  7241                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  7242                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  7243                                  
  7244 00001F7F 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)
  7245 00001F81 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  7246 00001F83 4B                      		dec	bx
  7247 00001F84 01C3                    		add	bx, ax		; dx=0
  7248 00001F86 D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  7249 00001F88 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  7250 00001F89 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  7251 00001F8C 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
  7252 00001F8E D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1
  7253 00001F90 01F3                    		add	bx, si
  7254 00001F92 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  7255 00001F96 D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  7256 00001F98 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  7257                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  7258 00001F9B EB33                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
  7259                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7260                                  
  7261                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  7262                                  
  7263                                  dobig:					
  7264 00001F9D B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  7265 00001F9F 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  7266 00001FA0 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  7267 00001FA3 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  7268 00001FA5 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  7269 00001FA7 5A                      		pop	dx
  7270 00001FA8 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  7271 00001FAB 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  7272 00001FAE 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  7273                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  7274 00001FB1 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  7275 00001FB3 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  7276                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  7277                                  
  7278                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  7279                                  
  7280                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  7281                                  		; 27/09/2022
  7282                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  7283                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  7284                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  7285                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  7286                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  7287                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  7288                                  		
  7289                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  7290 00001FB6 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  7291 00001FB8 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  7292 00001FBB 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  7293 00001FBE 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  7294                                  
  7295                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  7296                                  
  7297 00001FC1 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  7298                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  7299 00001FC3 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  7300                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  7301                                  
  7302                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  7303                                  
  7304                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7305                                  		; [di+1Fh] = [fbigfat]
  7306                                  		;
  7307                                  		;;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  7308                                  		;; 17/10/2022
  7309                                  		;mov	bl, [fbigfat]
  7310                                  		;mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag
  7311                                  
  7312                                  		; 14/08/2023

  7700                                  
  7701                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  7702                                  ;
  7703                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  7704                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  7705                                  ;
  7706                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  7707                                  ;
  7708                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  7709                                  ;   initialize it.
  7710                                  ;
  7711                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  7712                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  7713                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  7714                                  ;
  7715                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  7716                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  7717                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  7718                                  ;
  7719                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  7720                                  ;   save coding.
  7721                                  ;
  7722                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  7723                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  7724                                  ;
  7725                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  7726                                  ;
  7727                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  7728                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  7729                                  ;
  7730                                  ; called modules:

  7746 000020F6 8A36[4517]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  7747                                  		; 10/12/2022

  7749                                  		;cmp	dh, 0

  7751 000020FE B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  7752                                  domini_loop:
  7753 00002100 52                      		push	dx
  7754 00002101 8816[4417]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  7755 00002105 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  7756 00002107 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7757                                  					; DL = drive number
  7758                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  7759                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  7760                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  7761 00002109 FEC6                    		inc	dh

  7773                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias

  7787                                  ; 15/10/2022 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

  7790                                  ;find_mini_partition tries to find every extended partition on a disk.
  7791                                  ;at entry:	di -> bdsm entry
  7792                                  ;		es:bx -> 07c0:bootbias - master boot record
  7793                                  ;		rom_minidisk_num - rom drive number
  7794                                  ;		drvmax - logical drive number
  7795                                  ;		mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  7796                                  ;
  7797                                  ;called routine: setmini which uses set2 (in sethard routine)
  7798                                  ;variables & equates used from original bios - flags, fnon_removable, fbigfat
  7799                                  
  7800                                  
  7801                                  find_mini_partition:	
  7802 0000212E 81C3C201                		add	bx, 1C2h	; bx ->	file system id
  7803                                  fmpnext:				
  7804 00002132 26803F05                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 5 ; 5 = extended partition id.
  7805 00002136 740A                    		jz	short fmpgot
  7806 00002138 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  7807 0000213B 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  7808 0000213F 75F1                    		jnz	short fmpnext
  7809                                  		;jmp	short fmpnextfound ; extended partition	not found
  7810                                  		; 18/12/2022
  7811                                  fmpnextfound:
  7812 00002141 C3                      		retn
  7813                                  
  7814                                  ;		; 30/07/2019 - Retro DOS v3.2
  7815                                  ;		jb	short fmpnext
  7816                                  ;fmpret:
  7817                                  ;		retn	; 29/05/2019
  7818                                  
  7819                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7820                                  
  7821                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7822                                  fmpgot:					; found my partition.		
  7823 00002142 E89D00                  		call	dmax_check	; check	for drvmax already 26
  7824 00002145 73FA                    		jnb	short fmpnextfound ; done if too many
  7825 00002147 8B3E[4817]              		mov	di, [end_of_bdss] ; get next free bds
  7826 0000214B C745470100              		mov	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  7827                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7828 00002150 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1
  7829                                  		;or	word [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  7830                                  					; fNon_Removable
  7831 00002154 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  7832                                  					; ffHardFile
  7833 00002158 C606[C816]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit fat.
  7834 0000215D A1[4A17]                		mov	ax, [mini_hdlim]
  7835 00002160 894515                  		mov	[di+15h], ax	; [di+BDS.heads]
  7836 00002163 A1[4C17]                		mov	ax, [mini_seclim]
  7837 00002166 894513                  		mov	[di+13h], ax	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7838 00002169 A0[4417]                		mov	al, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7839 0000216C 884504                  		mov	[di+4],	al	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  7840                                  					; set physical number
  7841 0000216F A0[7500]                		mov	al, [drvmax]
  7842 00002172 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  7843                                  					; set logical number
  7844 00002175 26837F0A00              		cmp	word [es:bx+10], 0
  7845 0000217A 7707                    		ja	short fmpgot_cont
  7846 0000217C 26837F0840              		cmp	word [es:bx+8], 64 ; with current bpb,
  7847                                  					; only lower word is meaningful.
  7848 00002181 72BE                    		jb	short fmpnextfound
  7849                                  					; should be bigger than 64 sectors at least
  7850                                  fmpgot_cont:				
  7851 00002183 83EB04                  		sub	bx, 4		; let bx point to the start of the entry
  7852 00002186 268A7702                		mov	dh, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder
  7853 0000218A 80E6C0                  		and	dh, 0C0h	; get higher bits of cyl
  7854 0000218D D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  7855 0000218F D0C6                    		rol	dh, 1
  7856 00002191 268A5703                		mov	dl, [es:bx+3]	; cyl byte
  7857 00002195 895549                  		mov	[di+49h], dx	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  7858                                  					; set hidden trks
  7859 00002198 268B4F02                		mov	cx, [es:bx+2]	; cylinder,cylinder/sector
  7860 0000219C 268A7701                		mov	dh, [es:bx+1]	; head
  7861 000021A0 8A16[4417]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  7862 000021A4 BB0002                  		mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  7863 000021A7 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  7864 000021AA CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  7865                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  7866                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  7867                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  7868 000021AC 7293                    		jc	short fmpnextfound
  7869 000021AE BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  7870                                  
  7871                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7872                                  		;push	es
  7873 000021B1 E80800                  		call	setmini		; install a mini disk.
  7874                                  					; bx value saved.
  7875                                  		;pop	es  ; 14/08/2023
  7876 000021B4 7203                    		jc	short fmpnextchain
  7877 000021B6 E83E00                  		call	xinstall_bds	; -- install the bdsm into table
  7878                                  fmpnextchain:

  7880                                  					; if we	have any chained partition
  7881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7885                                  		;retn

  7909 000021D8 75E5                    		jnz	short setmini_1

  7911 000021DB 07                      		pop	es
  7912                                  		; 14/08/2023
