 14263                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14264                                  
 14265                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14266                                  
 14267                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14268                                  ;
 14269                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14270                                  ;
 14271                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14272                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14273                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14274                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14275                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14276                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14277                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14278                                  ;
 14279                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14280                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14281                                  ;
 14282                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14283                                  
 14284                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14285                                  HMAPtr:
 14286 00001372 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14287                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14288 00001377 8B3E[EB08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14289                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14290 0000137B 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14291 0000137E 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14292 00001380 803E[F108]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14293                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14294 00001385 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14295 00001387 FF1E[ED08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14296                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14297 0000138B 8B3E[EB08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14298                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14299                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14300 0000138F C3                      		retn
 14301                                  
 14302                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14303                                  
 14304                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14305                                  
 14306                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14307                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14308                                  
 14309                                  move_sector:
 14310                                  
 14311                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14312                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14313                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14314                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14315                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14316                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14317                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14318                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14319                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14320                                  ;
 14321                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14322                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14323                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14324                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14325                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14326                                  
 14327 00001390 FC                      		cld
 14328 00001391 51                      		push	cx
 14329 00001392 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14330 00001395 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14331 00001399 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14332 0000139B 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14333 0000139F 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14334 000013A1 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14335 000013A3 59                      		pop	cx
 14336 000013A4 C3                      		retn
 14337                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14338                                  
 14339                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14340 000013A5 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14341 000013A7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14342 000013A9 59                      		pop	cx
 14343 000013AA C3                      		retn
 14344                                  
 14345                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14346                                  
 14347                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14348                                  
 14349                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14350                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14351                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14352                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14353                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14354                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14355                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14356                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14357                                  ;
 14358                                  ; input conditions:
 14359                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14360                                  ;
 14361                                  ; output:
 14362                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14363                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14364                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14365                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14366                                  
 14367                                  check_wrap:	
 14368 000013AB 50                      		push	ax
 14369 000013AC 53                      		push	bx
 14370 000013AD 06                      		push	es
 14371 000013AE 57                      		push	di
 14372 000013AF E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14373 000013B2 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14374                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14375 000013B4 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14376                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14377 000013B9 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14378 000013BB 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14379 000013BF 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14380 000013C1 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14381 000013C4 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14382 000013C6 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14383 000013C8 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14384                                  
 14385                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14386                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14387                                  
 14388 000013CA 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14389 000013CC 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14390                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14391 000013CE 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14392 000013CF 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14393                                  					; if on	boundary
 14394                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14395                                  not_on_bound:				
 14396 000013D1 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14397 000013D4 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14398 000013D6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14399 000013D8 40                      		inc	ax
 14400 000013D9 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14401 000013DB 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14402                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14403 000013DE 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14404 000013E2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14405                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14406                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14407 000013E4 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14408 000013E6 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14409 000013E7 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14410                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14411 000013E9 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14412                                  
 14413                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14414                                  
 14415 000013EB 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14416 000013ED 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14417 000013EF 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14418                                  
 14419                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14420                                  
 14421 000013F1 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14422 000013F3 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14423 000013F5 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14424                                  no_head_bound:				
 14425 000013F6 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14426 000013F8 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14427 000013F9 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14428 000013FB 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14429 000013FD 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14430 000013FF 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14431 00001402 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14432 00001404 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14433 00001406 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14434 00001408 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14435 0000140A 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14436 0000140C D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14437 0000140E 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14438 00001410 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14439                                  no_wrap:				
 14440 00001412 F8                      		clc
 14441 00001413 5F                      		pop	di
 14442 00001414 07                      		pop	es
 14443 00001415 5B                      		pop	bx
 14444 00001416 58                      		pop	ax
 14445 00001417 C3                      		retn
 14446                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14447                                  
 14448                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14449 00001418 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14450 0000141A FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14451 0000141C EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14452                                  
 14453                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14454                                  
 14455                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14456                                  
 14457                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14458                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14459                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14460                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14461                                  ;
 14462                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14463                                  
 14464                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14465                                  find_bds:	
 14466 0000141E C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14467                                  fbds_1:					
 14468 00001422 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14469 00001426 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14470 00001428 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14471                                  					; go to next bds
 14472 0000142B 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14473 0000142E 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14474 00001430 F9                      		stc
 14475                                  fdbs_2:					
 14476 00001431 C3                      		retn
 14477                                  
 14478                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14479                                  
 14480                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14481                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14482                                  doint:
 14483                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14484 00001432 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14485                                  					; get physical drive number
 14486                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14487                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14488                                  		
 14489 00001435 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14490 00001437 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14491 00001439 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14492                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14493 0000143B 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14494                                  					; get request code
 14495                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14496 0000143E FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14497                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14498 00001441 9D                      		popf
 14499                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14500                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14501 00001442 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14502                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14503                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14504 00001447 9C                      		pushf
 14505                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14506 00001448 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14507                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14508                                  dointdone:				
 14509 0000144B C3                      		retn
 14510                                  
 14511                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14512                                  
 14513                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14514                                  
 14515                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14516                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14517                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14518                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14519                                  ;
 14520                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14521                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14522                                  ;
 14523                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14524                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14525                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14526                                  
 14527                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14528                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14529                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14530                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14531                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14532                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14533                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14534                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14535                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14536                                  ;end struc
 14537                                  
 14538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14539                                  
 14540                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14541                                  ;	ah = function
 14542                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14543                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14544                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14545                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14546                                  ;   output conditions:
 14547                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14548                                  
 14549                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14550                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14551                                  ;
 14552                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14553                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14554                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14555                                  
 14556                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14557                                  
 14558                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14559                                  
 14560 0000144C 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14561                                  
 14562                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14563                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14564                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14565                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14566                                  
 14567                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14568                                  
 14569                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14570                                  
 14571                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14572                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14573                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14574                                  
 14575                                  format_special_stuff:
 14576 00001450 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 14577 00001455 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14578 00001457 53                      		push	bx
 14579 00001458 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14580 0000145B E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14581 0000145E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14582 0000145F EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14583                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14584                                  
 14585                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14586                                  
 14587                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14588                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14589                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14590                                  
 14591                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14592                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14593 00001461 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14594 00001463 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14595 00001465 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14596 00001466 51                      		push	cx
 14597 00001467 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14598 00001469 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14599 0000146B D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14600 0000146D 8406[2805]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14601 00001471 59                      		pop	cx
 14602 00001472 58                      		pop	ax
 14603 00001473 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14604                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14605 00001475 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14606 00001476 06                      		push	es
 14607                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14608 00001477 2EC41E[4C14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14609                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14610                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14611 0000147C 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14612 0000147E 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14613 00001481 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14614                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14615                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14616 00001485 07                      		pop	es
 14617 00001486 5B                      		pop	bx
 14618 00001487 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14619                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14620                                  
 14621                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14622                                  
 14623                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14624                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14625                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14626                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14627                                  
 14628                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14629 00001489 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14630                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14631 0000148E 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14632 00001490 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14633                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14634 00001495 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14635                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14636 00001497 50                      		push	ax
 14637 00001498 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14638                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14639                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14640 0000149A 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14641                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14642                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14643 0000149F 58                      		pop	ax
 14644 000014A0 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14645                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14646                                  
 14647                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14648                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14649                                  
 14650                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14651                                  
 14652                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14653                                  
 14654                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14655                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14656                                  
 14657                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14658 000014A2 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14659                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14660                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14661 000014A3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14662                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14663                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14664                                  
 14665                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14666                                  
 14667 000014A8 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14668 000014AB 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14669 000014AE 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14670                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14671                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14672 000014B0 803E[2805]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14673 000014B5 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14674                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14675                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14676                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14677 000014B7 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14678                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14679                                  		
 14680 000014BC 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14681                                  		
 14682 000014BD 803E[3506]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14683                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14684 000014C2 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14685                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14686                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14687 000014C4 9D                      		popf
 14688 000014C5 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14689                                  ret_from_i13:
 14690 000014C7 1F                      		pop	ds
 14691 000014C8 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14692                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14693                                  
 14694                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14695                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14696                                  ; a changeline error.
 14697                                  
 14698                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14699 000014CB 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14700                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14701 000014CD 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14702 000014D0 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14703 000014D2 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14704 000014D4 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14705 000014D6 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14706 000014DB 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14707                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14708                                  					; never	would
 14709 000014DD 53                      		push	bx
 14710 000014DE BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14711 000014E1 E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14712 000014E4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14713                                  int13b:
 14714 000014E5 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14715 000014E6 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14716                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14717                                  
 14718                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14719                                  
 14720                                  goterr13:				
 14721 000014E8 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14722 000014EB 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14723                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14724 000014ED 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14725 000014F0 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14726 000014F2 803E[2F06]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14727 000014F7 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14728                                  
 14729 000014F9 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14730                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14731                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14732                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14733 000014FE 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14734                                  
 14735 00001500 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14736                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14737                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14738 00001502 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14739                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14740                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14741 00001507 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14742 0000150A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14743 0000150C 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14744 0000150E 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14745 00001510 53                      		push	bx
 14746 00001511 51                      		push	cx
 14747 00001512 52                      		push	dx
 14748 00001513 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14749                                  loop_ecc:
 14750 00001516 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14751                                  
 14752                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14753                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14754                                  ;
 14755                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14756                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14757                                  ; track.
 14758                                  ;
 14759                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14760                                  ; this request.
 14761                                  ;
 14762                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14763                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14764                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14765                                  ;
 14766 00001519 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14767                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14768                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14769 0000151C 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14770                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14771 00001521 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14772 00001523 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14773 00001526 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14774 00001528 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14775 0000152B 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14776                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14777                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14778                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14779 0000152D 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14780                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14781                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14782                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14783                                  ok11_op:
 14784 0000152F FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14785 00001533 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14786 00001535 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14787                                  					; add 200h to address
 14788 00001537 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14789 00001539 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14790 0000153B EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14791                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14792                                  
 14793                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14794                                  
 14795                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14796 0000153D F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14797                                  ok11_exit:
 14798 0000153E 5A                      		pop	dx
 14799 0000153F 59                      		pop	cx
 14800 00001540 5B                      		pop	bx
 14801 00001541 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14802                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14803                                  
 14804                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14805                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14806                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14807                                  
 14808                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14809 00001543 06                      		push	es
 14810 00001544 53                      		push	bx
 14811 00001545 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14812 00001548 1E                      		push	ds
 14813 00001549 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14814 0000154A B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14815                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14816                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14817 0000154D 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14818                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14819 00001552 5B                      		pop	bx
 14820 00001553 07                      		pop	es
 14821 00001554 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14822 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14823 00001559 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14824                                  
 14825                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14826                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14827                                  
 14828                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14829 0000155B 56                      		push	si
 14830 0000155C 57                      		push	di
 14831 0000155D 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14832 0000155F BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14833 00001562 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14834 00001565 5F                      		pop	di
 14835 00001566 5E                      		pop	si
 14836 00001567 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14837                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14838                                  
 14839                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14840                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14841                                  
 14842                                  gotdmaerr:
 14843 00001569 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14844 0000156C FB                      		sti
 14845 0000156D 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14846 00001570 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14847                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14848                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14849 00001572 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14850 00001575 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14851 00001577 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14852 0000157A 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14853 0000157C 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14854                                  
 14855                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14856                                  
 14857                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14858                                  
 14859 0000157E 52                      		push	dx
 14860 0000157F 51                      		push	cx
 14861 00001580 53                      		push	bx
 14862 00001581 50                      		push	ax
 14863 00001582 55                      		push	bp
 14864 00001583 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14865 00001585 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14866 00001587 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14867 00001589 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14868 0000158B D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14869 0000158D D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14870 0000158F 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14871 00001591 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14872                                  
 14873                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14874                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14875                                  
 14876 00001595 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14877 00001597 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14878                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14879                                  
 14880                                  no_skip_first:
 14881 0000159A D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14882 0000159C B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14883 0000159E 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14884                                  
 14885                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14886                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14887                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14888                                  ;
 14889                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14890                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14891                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14892                                  ; in error.
 14893                                  
 14894 000015A0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14895 000015A2 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14896                                  
 14897                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14898                                  
 14899 000015A4 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14900                                  					; set up head number
 14901 000015A7 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14902 000015AA E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14904                                  
 14905                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14906 000015AD B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14907 000015AF F9                      		stc
 14908 000015B0 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14909                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14910                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14911                                  
 14912                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14913                                  
 14914                                  intverify:
 14915 000015B3 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14916 000015B4 53                      		push	bx
 14917 000015B5 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14918 000015B6 07                      		pop	es
 14919                                  dosimple:
 14920 000015B7 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14921                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14922                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14923                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14924 000015BA 9A[8E07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14925                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14926 000015BF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14927 000015C0 07                      		pop	es
 14928 000015C1 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14929                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14930                                  
 14931                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14932                                  
 14933                                  intformat:
 14934 000015C4 06                      		push	es
 14935 000015C5 53                      		push	bx
 14936 000015C6 56                      		push	si
 14937 000015C7 57                      		push	di
 14938 000015C8 1E                      		push	ds
 14939                                  
 14940                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14941                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14942                                  
 14943 000015C9 06                      		push	es
 14944 000015CA 1E                      		push	ds
 14945 000015CB 07                      		pop	es
 14946 000015CC 1F                      		pop	ds
 14947 000015CD 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14948 000015CF BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14949 000015D2 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14950 000015D5 1F                      		pop	ds
 14951 000015D6 5F                      		pop	di
 14952 000015D7 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14953 000015D8 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14954                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14955                                  
 14956                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14957                                  ; the first block.
 14958                                  ;
 14959                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14960                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14961                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14962                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14963                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14964                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14965                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14966                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14967                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14968                                  
 14969                                  doblock:
 14970                                  
 14971                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14972                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14973                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14974                                  				
 14975 000015DA 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14976                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14977 000015DD 51                      		push	cx
 14978 000015DE 06                      		push	es
 14979 000015DF 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14980                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14981 000015E0 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14982 000015E3 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14983                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14984 000015E7 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14985                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14986 000015EC 5F                      		pop	di
 14987 000015ED 07                      		pop	es
 14988 000015EE 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14989 000015F0 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14990 000015F2 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14991 000015F4 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14992                                  doblockflop:
 14993 000015F6 59                      		pop	cx
 14994                                  doblockcontinue:
 14995 000015F7 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14996 000015F9 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14997 000015FB 50                      		push	ax
 14998 000015FC 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14999 000015FE EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 15000                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15001                                  
 15002                                  doblocklast:
 15003 00001600 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 15004 00001602 50                      		push	ax
 15005                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 15006 00001603 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 15007 00001606 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 15008 00001608 58                      		pop	ax
 15009 00001609 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 15010                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 15011 0000160C 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 15012 0000160E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 15013 00001610 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 15014 00001612 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 15015 00001614 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 15016                                  					; then we are done already.
 15017 00001616 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 15018                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 15019 00001618 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 15020 0000161B EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 15021                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15022                                  
 15023                                  bufferx:
 15024 0000161D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 15025                                  					; set up head number
 15026                                  buffer:
 15027 00001620 53                      		push	bx
 15028 00001621 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 15029 00001624 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 15030 00001627 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 15031                                  
 15032                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 15033                                  
 15034 00001629 06                      		push	es
 15035 0000162A 1E                      		push	ds
 15036 0000162B 56                      		push	si
 15037 0000162C 57                      		push	di
 15038 0000162D 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 15039 0000162E 06                      		push	es
 15040 0000162F 1F                      		pop	ds
 15041 00001630 07                      		pop	es
 15042 00001631 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 15043 00001634 57                      		push	di		; save it
 15044 00001635 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 15045 00001637 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 15046 0000163A 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 15047                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 15048 0000163B 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 15049 0000163C 5E                      		pop	si
 15050 0000163D 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 15051                                  
 15052                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 15053                                  
 15054 0000163E B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15055                                  					; get drive number
 15056 00001640 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 15057 00001643 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 15058                                  					;
 15059                                  					; ah is	function
 15060                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 15061                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 15062                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 15063                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 15064                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 15065 00001646 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 15066 00001649 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 15067 0000164A 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 15068 0000164C EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 15069                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15070                                  
 15071                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 15072                                  
 15073                                  doread:
 15074 0000164E 06                      		push	es
 15075 0000164F 53                      		push	bx
 15076 00001650 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 15077 00001651 07                      		pop	es
 15078 00001652 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 15079 00001655 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 15080 00001657 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15081                                  					; get drive number
 15082 0000165A E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 15083                                  					; ah = function
 15084                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 15085                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 15086                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 15087 0000165D E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 15088 00001660 5B                      		pop	bx
 15089 00001661 07                      		pop	es
 15090 00001662 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 15091 00001664 56                      		push	si
 15092 00001665 57                      		push	di
 15093 00001666 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 15094 00001668 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 15095 0000166B E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 15096 0000166E 5F                      		pop	di
 15097 0000166F 5E                      		pop	si
 15098                                  
 15099                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 15100                                  
 15101                                  dotail:
 15102 00001670 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 15103 00001671 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 15104 00001674 41                      		inc	cx
 15105 00001675 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 15106 00001678 F8                      		clc
 15107 00001679 FEC8                    		dec	al
 15108 0000167B 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 15109                                  
 15110                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 15111                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 15112                                  
 15113 0000167D 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 15114 00001680 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 15115 00001683 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 15116                                  
 15117                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 15118                                  
 15119                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 15120                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 15121                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 15122                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 15123                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 15124                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 15125                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 15126                                  
 15127                                  bad13:
 15128 00001686 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 15129 00001688 5D                      		pop	bp
 15130 00001689 5B                      		pop	bx
 15131 0000168A 5B                      		pop	bx
 15132 0000168B 59                      		pop	cx
 15133 0000168C 5A                      		pop	dx
 15134 0000168D 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 15135 0000168F E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 15136                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15137                                  
 15138                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 15139 00001692 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 15140                                  
 15141                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15142                                  		; 10/12/2022
 15143                                  		;db 	0
 15144                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15145                                  
 15146                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 15147                                  
 15148                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 15149                                  
 15150                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15151                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 15152                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15153                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15154                                  
 15155                                  		; 19/10/2022
 15156                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 15157 00001695 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 15158 00001699 BF[7E06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 15159 0000169C 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 15160 0000169D 07                      		pop	es
 15161 0000169E E912EF                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 15162                                  
 15163                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 15164                                  
 15165                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15166                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 15167                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 15168                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 15169                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15170                                  
 15171                                  install_bds:		
 15172 000016A1 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 15173 000016A2 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 15174                                  
 15175                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 15176                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 15177                                  loop_next_bds:				
 15178 000016A5 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 15179                                  					; fetch	next bds
 15180 000016A7 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 15181 000016AB 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 15182                                  					; drive	with new one?
 15183 000016AE 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 15184 000016B0 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 15185 000016B2 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15186                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 15187 000016B6 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15188 000016B9 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 15189                                  					; we don't own it
 15190 000016BE 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 15191                                  					; determine if changeline available
 15192 000016C1 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 15193 000016C4 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 15194                                  next_bds:				
 15195                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 15196 000016C8 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 15197 000016CB 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15198                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 15199                                  					; are we at end	of list?

 15206                                  					; set next pointer to null
 15207 000016D7 1F                      		pop	ds
