 16393                                  struc	SRHEAD
 16394 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 16395 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 16396 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 16397 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 16398 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 16399                                  .size:
 16400                                  endstruc
 16401                                  
 16402                                  ;Status word masks
 16403                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 16404                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 16405                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 16406                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 16407                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 16408                                  
 16409                                  ;Function codes
 16410                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 16411                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 16412                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 16413                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 16414                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 16415                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 16416                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 16417                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 16418                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 16419                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 16420                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 16421                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 16422                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 16423                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 16424                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 16425                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 16426                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 16427                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 16428                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 16429                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 16430                                  
 16431                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16432                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16433 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16434 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16435 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16436 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16437 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16438 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16439                                                          ; word
 16440 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16441 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16442 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16443 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16444                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16445                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16446                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16447                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16448                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16449                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16450                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16451                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16452 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16453 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16454 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16455 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16456 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16457 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16458                                  .size:
 16459                                  endstruc

 16461                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16462                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16463                                  
 16464                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16465                                  
 16466                                  struc buffinfo
 16467 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16468 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16469 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16470                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16471                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16472 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16473                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16474                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16475                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16476                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16477                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16478                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16479                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16480                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16481 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16482                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16483 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16484 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16485 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16486 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16487 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16488                                  .size:
 16489                                  endstruc
 16490                                  
 16491                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16492                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16493                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16494                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16495                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16496                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16497                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16498                                  
 16499                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16500                                  
 16501                                  
 16502                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16503

 16505                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16506                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16507                                  ;***
 16508                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16509                                  ;***
 16510                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16511                                  
 16512                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16513                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16514                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B

 16521                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16522                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16523                                  
 16524                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16525                                  
 16526                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16527                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16528                                  ;
 16529                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16530                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16531                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16532                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16533                                  ;
 16534                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16535                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16536                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16537                                  
 16538                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16539                                  
 16540                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16541                                  
 16542                                  struc	DPB
 16543 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16544 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16545 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16546 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16547 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16548 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16549 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16550 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16551 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16552 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16553                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16554 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16555 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16556 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16557 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16558 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16559                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16560 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16561 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16562 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16563                                  .size:
 16564                                  endstruc
 16565                                  
 16566                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 16567                                  
 16568                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 16626                                  
 16627                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16628                                  ;
 16629                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16630                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16631                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16632                                  ;
 16633                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16634                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16635                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16636                                  ;
 16637                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16638                                  
 16639                                  struc A_BPB
 16640 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 16641 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 16642 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 16643 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 16644 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 16645 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16646 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 16647 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 16648 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 16649 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 16650 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 16651 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 16652 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16653 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 16654 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 16655                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 16656                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 16657                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 16658                                  .size:
 16659                                  endstruc
 16660

 16918                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16919                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16921                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16922                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16923                                  									  
 16924                                  ;*******************************					  
 16925                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16926                                  ;*******************************					  
 16927                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16928                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16929                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16930                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16931                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16932                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16933                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16934                                  ;For all others:							  
 16935                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16936                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16937                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16938                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16939                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16940                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16941                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16942                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16943                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16944                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16945                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16946                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16947                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16948                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16949                                  ;									  
 16950                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16951                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16952                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16953                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16954                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16955                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16956                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16957                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16958                                  ;									  
 16959                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16960                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16961                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16962                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16963                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16964                                  ;									  
 16965                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16966                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16967                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16968                                  ;									  
 16969                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16970                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16971                                  ;									  
 16972                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16973                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16974                                  ;									  
 16975                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16976                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16977                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16978                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16979                                  ;						called. 		  
 16980                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16981                                  ;									  
 16982                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16983                                  ;									  
 16984                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16985                                  ;									  
 16986                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16987                                  ;									  
 16988                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16989                                  ;									  
 16990                                  
 16991                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16992                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16993 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16994 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16995                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16996 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16997 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16998 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16999 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 17000                                  endstruc					  
 17001

 17005                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b

 17007                                  					;;End of Modification

 17109                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17110                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17111                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17112                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17113                                  
 17114                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 17115                                  ;
 17116                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 17117                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 17118                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 17119                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 17120                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 17121                                  ;
 17122                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 17123                                  ;
 17124                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 17125                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 17126                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 17127                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 17128                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 17129                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 17130                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 17131                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 17132                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 17133                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 17134                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 17135                                  
 17136                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 17137                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 17138                                  
 17139                                  struc 		curdir_list
 17140                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 17141 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 17142 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 17143 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 17144 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 17145 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 17146 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 17147                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 17148 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 17149 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 17150 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 17151                                  .size:
 17152                                  endstruc
 17153                                  
 17154                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 17155                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 17156                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 17157                                  						; argument
 17158                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 17159                                  
 17160                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 17161                                  
 17162                                  ;Flag word masks
 17163                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17164                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 17165                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 17166                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 17167                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 17169                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17170                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 17171                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17172                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17173                                  
 17174                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.1 (BugFix)
 17175                                  
 17176                                  ; system file table
 17177                                  
 17178                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 17179                                  ;
 17180                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 17181                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 17182                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 17183                                  
 17184                                  struc	SF
 17185 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 17186 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 17187 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 17188                                  .size:
 17189                                  endstruc
 17190                                  
 17191                                  ;**	System file table entry
 17192                                  ;
 17193                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 17194                                  
 17195                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 17196 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 17197                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 17198 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 17199 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 17200 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 17201                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 17202                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 17203                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 17204                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 17205                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 17206                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 17207                                  					;   (WRITE)
 17208                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 17209                                  					;
 17210                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 17211                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 17212                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 17213                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 17214                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 17215                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 17216                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 17217                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 17218                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 17219                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 17220                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 17221                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 17222 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 17223                                  					; to device header if local device,
 17224                                  					; points to net device header if
 17225                                  					; remote
 17226 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 17227                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 17228 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 17229 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 17230 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 17231 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 17232                                  ;
 17233                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 17234                                  ; ID
 17235                                  ;
 17236 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 17237 0000001B ????????                .sf_dirsec:	resd	1 ; 09/04/2024	; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 17238 0000001F ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 17239                                  ;
 17240                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 17241                                  ;
 17242 00000020 <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 17243                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 17244                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 17245                                  					; disk changed errors.
 17246                                  ; SHARING INFO
 17247 0000002B ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 17248 0000002F ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 17249 00000031 ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 17250 00000033 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 17251 00000035 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 17252 00000037 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 17253                                  .size:
 17254                                  endstruc

 17534                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17535                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17536                                  
 17537                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17538                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17539                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17540                                  
 17541                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17542                                  ;
 17543                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17544                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17545                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17546                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17547                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17548                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17549                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17550                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17551                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17552                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17553                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17554                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17555                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17556                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17557                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17558                                  ;
 17559                                  
 17560                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17561                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17562                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17563                                  ;
 17564                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17565                                  ;
 17566                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17567                                  ;
 17568                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17569                                  ;
 17570                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17571                                  ;
 17572                                  
 17573                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17574                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17575                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17576                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17577                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17578                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17579                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17580                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17581                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17582                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17583                                  
 17584                                  		;EVEN
 17585                                  ;align 2
 17586                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17587                                  
 17588 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17589 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17590 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17591 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17592 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17593 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17594                                  
 17595 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17596 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17597 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17598                                  
 17599                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17600                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17601                                  
 17602                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17603                                  
 17604 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17605                                  
 17606                                  int02:
 17607                                  
 17608                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17609                                  ;
 17610                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17611                                  ;
 17612                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17613                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17614                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17615                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17616                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17617                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17618                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17619                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17620                                  ;
 17621                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17622                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17623                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17624                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17625                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17626                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17627                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17628                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17629                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17630                                  ;
 17631                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17632                                  
 17633 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17634 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17635 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17636 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17637                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17638 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17639 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17640 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17641                                  
 17642 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17643                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17644                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17645                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17646                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17647 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17648 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17649                                  special02:
 17650 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax

 17883                                  ;********************************************************************
 17884                                  ;common routines
 17885                                  ;********************************************************************
 17886                                  
 17887                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17888                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17889                                  ; service routine
 17890                                  
 17891                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17892                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17893                                  
 17894                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17895                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17896                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17897                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17898                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17899                                  
 17900                                  do_int_stacks:
 17901 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17902 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17903 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17904 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17905 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17906 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17907                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17908                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17909                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17910 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17911 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17912 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 17913                                  
 17914 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17915                                  
 17916                                  found02:
 17917 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17918 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17919                                  
 17920 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17921                                  
 17922 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17923                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17924                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17925                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17926                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17927 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17928 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17929                                  
 17930                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17931                                  	;mov	es,bp
 17932                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 17933                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17934                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 17935                                  	;mov	sp,es
 17936                                  	;mov	es,ax
 17937                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17938                                  
 17939                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 17940 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 17941 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 17942 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17943 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 17944 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 17945 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 17946 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 17947 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 17948                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17949                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17950 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17951                                  
 17952 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17953                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17954 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17955                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17956                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17957                                  
 17958 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17959                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17960 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17961                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17962                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17963 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17964 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17965                                  
 17966                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17967                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17968                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17969 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17970 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17971                                  
 17972 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 17973 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17974 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17975 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17976 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17977                                  
 17978                                  notfree02:
 17979 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17980 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17981                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17982                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17983                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17984 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17985                                  
 17986                                  findnext02:
 17987 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17988 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 17989                                  
 17990                                  foundbad02:
 17991 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17992 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17993 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17994                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17995                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17996                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17997 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17998 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17999                                  
 18000                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18001                                  
 18002                                  ; Common routines
 18003                                  
 18004                                  longpath:
 18005                                  	; 21/03/2019
 18006 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 18007                                  lploopp:
 18008                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18009                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 18010                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18011 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 18012 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 18013                                  
 18014 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 18015                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18016                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 18017                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18018 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 18019 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 18020 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 18021                                  
 18022 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 18023 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 18024                                  
 18025                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18026                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 18027                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18028 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 18029                                  inuse:
 18030 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 18031 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 18032 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 18033 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 18034                                  found:
 18035 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 18036                                  fatal:
 18037 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 18038 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 18039 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18040 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 18041 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 18042 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 18043                                  
 18044 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 18045 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 18046                                  
 18047                                  skip_nmis:
 18048 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 18049 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 18050 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 18051 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 18052                                  
 18053 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 18054 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 18055 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 18056                                  ;SR;
 18057                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 18058                                  ;
 18059 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 18060 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 18061                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 18062                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 18063                                  	; 21/10/2022
 18064 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 18065 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18066                                  
 18067                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 18068 0000021C F606[C508]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 18069 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 18070 00000222 58                      	pop	ax

 18425                                  ; set fake_floppy_drv if there is no diskette drives in this machine.

 18444                                  ; WARNING !!!
 18445                                  ;

 18507                                  ;;		  before we try to run.
 18508                                  ;;	       b) in any case, we should check for sufficient memory and give
 18509                                  ;;		  an appropriate error diagnostic if there isn't enough

 18512                                  ;	pop	ds
 18513                                  ;
 18514                                  ;;	cas note:  It would be better to put dos + bios_code BELOW sysinit
 18515                                  ;;	  that way it would be easier to slide them down home in a minimal
 18516                                  ;;	  memory system after sysinit.  As it is, you need room to keep
 18517                                  ;;	  two full non-overlapping copies, since sysinit sits between the
 18518                                  ;;	  temporary home and the final one.  the problem with doing that
 18519                                  ;;	  is that sys*.asm are filled with "mov ax,cs, sub ax,11h" type stuff.

 19254                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19255                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19256                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19257                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19258                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19259                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19260                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19261                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19262                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19263                                  ;
 19264                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19265                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19266                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19267                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19268                                  ; been patched.
 19269

 19569 000007C6 BA[4433]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19570                                  
 19571                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19572                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19573                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19574                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19575                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19576                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19577                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19578                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19579                                  
 19580                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19581                                  
 19582 000007C9 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 19583 000007CA BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 19585 000007CF CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 19586 000007D1 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19587 000007D3 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 19588 000007D5 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 19589                                  
 19590 000007D7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19591 000007D9 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 19592 000007DB CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 19593 000007DD 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 19594                                  
 19595                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 19596                                  
 19597                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 19598                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 19599                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 19600                                  
 19601                                  	; 22/10/2022
 19602                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 19604 000007E3 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 19605                                  
 19606                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19607                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19608                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19609                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19610                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19611                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19612                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19613                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19614                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19615                                  ;
 19616                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19617                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19618                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19619                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19620                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19621                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19622                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 19623                                  
 19624                                  	; 22/10/2022

 19871                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19872                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19873                                  ;
 19874                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19875                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19876                                  ;
 19877                                  ; Inputs : None
 19878                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19879                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19880                                  ;	   free memory.
 19881                                  ;
 19882                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19883                                  ;
 19884                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19885                                  
 19886                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19887                                  AllocFreeMem:
 19888 0000083E BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19889 00000841 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC

 19891 00000845 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19892 00000847 CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 19893                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19894                                  	; ds = cs
 19895                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 19896                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 19897 00000849 A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 19898 0000084C A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 19899 0000084F C3                      	retn				; start of free memory

 19908                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19909                                  ;
 19910                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 19911                                  ;
 19912                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 19913                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 19914                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 19915                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 19916                                  ;
 19917                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19918                                  
 19919                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19920                                  LoadDOSHiOrLo:
 19921                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19922                                  	; ds = cs

 19966                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19967                                  ;
 19968                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19969                                  ;
 19970                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19971                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19972                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19973                                  ;
 19974                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19975                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19976                                  ; 
 19977                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19978                                  
 19979                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19980                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19981                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19982                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19983                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19984                                  	; ds = cs
 19985 000008C5 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 19986 000008C8 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19987                                  
 19988                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19989                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19990                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19991                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19992                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19993                                  	; ds = cs
 19994 000008CA 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19995                                  ;else
 19996                                  ;	..
 19997                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19998                                  
 19999                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20000                                  	; ds = cs
 20001 000008CE 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 20002                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 20003 000008D0 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 20004                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 20005 000008D4 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 20006 000008D9 F8                      	clc
 20007                                  ttldhx:
 20008 000008DA C3                      	retn

 20010                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20011                                  ;
 20012                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 20013                                  ;
 20014                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 20015                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 20016                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 20017                                  ;
 20018                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 20019                                  ;
 20020                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20021                                  
 20022                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20023                                  MovDOSHi:
 20024                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20025                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20026                                  	; ds = cs
 20027 000008DB E8D500                  	call	AllocHMA
 20028 000008DE 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 20029 000008E0 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 20030 000008E3 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20031                                  
 20032                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 20033                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 20034                                  
 20035                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 20036                                  	; 24/03/2019
 20037                                  	
 20038                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20040                                  
 20041                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 20042                                  	
 20043                                  	; 14/05/2019
 20044                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20045                                  	;xor	di,di
 20046                                  	
 20047                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20048                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 20049                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20050                                  	; ds = cs
 20051 000008E8 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 20052 000008EC E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 20053                                  
 20054                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 20055                                  ;else
 20056                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 20057                                  ;
 20058                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 20059                                  ;
 20060                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 20061

 20063 000008F2 F8                      	clc
 20064                                  mdhx:
 20065 000008F3 C3                      	retn

 20348                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 20349                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20350                                  	; 14/05/2019

 20373 00000950 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 20374 00000952 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 20375 00000954 CD21                    	int	21h
 20376 00000956 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 20377                                   	; 23/10/2022
 20378                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 20379 00000958 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 20380                                  						;  BIOS code

 20391 0000096B C3                      	retn
 20392                                  
 20393                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20394                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20395                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20396                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20397                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20398                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20399                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20400                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20401                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20402                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20403                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20404                                  ;
 20405                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20406                                  
 20407                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20408                                  update_arena:
 20409 0000096C 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20410 0000096D 57                      	push	di
 20411 0000096E 51                      	push	cx
 20412 0000096F 52                      	push	dx
 20413                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20414                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20415                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20416                                  	; ds = cs 
 20417 00000970 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20418 00000974 4F                      	dec	di
 20419 00000975 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20420                                  						;  before sysvar
 20421 00000976 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20422                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20423 00000978 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20424 0000097D 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20425 0000097F 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20426                                  
 20427                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20428 00000981 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20429 00000986 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20430 00000988 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20431 0000098A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20432 0000098C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20433                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20434 0000098E 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20435                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20436 00000992 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20437 00000998 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20438                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20439 0000099A 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20440 0000099E 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20441                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20442                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20443 000009A0 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20444 000009A3 5A                      	pop	dx
 20445 000009A4 59                      	pop	cx
 20446 000009A5 5F                      	pop	di

 20468                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20469                                  ;
 20470                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20471                                  ;
 20472                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20473                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20474                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20475                                  ;
 20476                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20477                                  ;
 20478                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20479                                  
 20480                                  AllocHMA:
 20481                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20482                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20483                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20484                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20485                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20486                                  
 20487                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20488                                  ;
 20489                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20490                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20491                                  ;	push	ax
 20492                                  ;	popf
 20493                                  ;	pushf
 20494                                  ;	pop	ax
 20495                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20496                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20497                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20498                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20499                                  
 20500                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20501                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20502                                  
 20503 000009B3 1E                      	push	ds

 20512

 20515                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20516                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20517

 20550

 20552 000009F1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 20554 000009FA 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h

 20639                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20640                                  ;
 20641                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20642                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20643                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20644                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20645                                  ;
 20646                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20647                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20648                                  ;
 20649                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20650                                  
 20651                                  	; 13/04/2024
 20652                                  ;align 2
