 20654                                  
 20655                                  StartVDHead:
 20656                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20657                                  
 20658 00000A2C 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20659 00000A30 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20660 00000A32 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20661 00000A34 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20662 00000A36 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20663                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20664 00000A37 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20665                                  VDiskSig1:
 20666 00000A3E 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20667                                  
 20668                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20669                                  
 20670 00000A43 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20671                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20672 00000A49 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20673 00000A58 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20674 00000A5A 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20675                                  VDInt19:
 20676 00000A5B EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20677                                  OldVDInt19:
 20678 00000A5C 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20679                                  
 20680                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20681                                  
 20682                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20683 00000A60 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20684                                  VDiskSig2:
 20685 00000A63 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20686                                  
 20687                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20688                                  
 20689 00000A68 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20690 00000A6B 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20691 00000A6D 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20692 00000A6E 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20693 00000A70 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20694 00000A71 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20695 00000A73 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20696 00000A75 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20697 00000A76 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20698 00000A78 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20699 00000A7A 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20700 00000A7C 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20701 00000A7E 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)

 20706                                  ;
 20707                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20708                                  ;
 20709                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20710                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20711                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20712                                  ;
 20713                                  ; Inputs : None
 20714                                  ;
 20715                                  ; Outputs : None
 20716                                  ;
 20717                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20718                                  ;
 20719                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20720                                  
 20721                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20722                                  
 20723                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 20725 00000A82 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20726

 20728                                  
 20729                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20734                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20735 00000A8E 2EA3[5E0A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20736                                  
 20737                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20738                                  
 20739 00000A92 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory

 20741                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20743 00000A97 CD21                    	int	21h
 20744                                  
 20745                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20746                                  
 20747 00000A99 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20748 00000A9A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20749                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20750 00000A9C 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20751                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20752 00000AA3 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20753 00000AAA 40                      	inc	ax
 20754 00000AAB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20755                                  
 20756                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20757                                  
 20758 00000AAD FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time

 20761 00000AB4 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20762

 20764

 20776

 20843                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 20844                                  
 20845                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20846                                  
 20847                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20848                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20849                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20850                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20851                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20852                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20853                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20854                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20855                                  ;								      ;I070
 20856                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20857                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20858                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20859                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20860                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20861                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20862                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20863                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20864                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20865                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20866                                  ;								      ;I070
 20867                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20868                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20869                                  
 20870                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20871                                  	; ds = cs
 20872                                  
 20873 00000B28 06                      	push	es
 20874 00000B29 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20875 00000B2B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20876 00000B2D B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20877 00000B2F D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20878 00000B31 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20879 00000B33 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20880 00000B35 05[080B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20881 00000B38 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20882                                  
 20883                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20884                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20885                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax

 20892 00000B3E 8816[EC0A]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl

 20909                                  ;
 20910                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 20912                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20913                                  ;		the offset.

 20936 00000B6A 29C7                    	sub	di,ax

 20990                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20991                                  ;
 20992                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20993                                  ;
 20994                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20995                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20996                                  ;
 20997                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20998                                  
 20999                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21000                                  CPMHack:
 21001 00000B99 1E                      	push	ds
 21002 00000B9A B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 21003 00000B9D 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 21004                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 21005                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21006 00000B9F 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 21007 00000BA0 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 21008 00000BA2 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 21009 00000BA5 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 21010                                  	;mov	cx,5
 21011 00000BA8 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 21012 00000BAA FC                      	cld
 21013 00000BAB F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 21014 00000BAD 1F                      	pop	ds
 21015 00000BAE C3                      	retn

 21913                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21914                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21915                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21916                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21917                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21918                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21919                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21920                                  ;
 21921                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21922                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21923                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21924                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21925                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21926                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21927                                  ;
 21928                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21929                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21930                                  ;
 21931                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21932                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21933                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21934                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21935                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21936                                  ;
 21937                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21938                                  ;
 21939                                  ;			  none.
 21940                                  
 21941                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21942                                  ;
 21943                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21944                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21945                                  
 21946                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21947

 22148                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22149                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22150                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22151                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22152                                  ;
 22153                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22154                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22155                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22156                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22157                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22158                                  ; program).
 22159                                  
 22160                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22161                                  
 22162                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22163                                  
 22164 00001013 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22165                                  
 22166                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22167                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22168                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22169                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22170                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22171                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22172                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22173                                  ; carridge return.
 22174                                  
 22175                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22176                                  ;character after =.
 22177                                  
 22178 00001014 06                      	push	es
 22179 00001015 1E                      	push	ds
 22180 00001016 07                      	pop	es
 22181 00001017 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22182 00001018 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22183                                  
 22184 0000101A 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22185 0000101C FC                      	cld
 22186 0000101D 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22187 00001023 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22188                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22189 00001026 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22190 00001027 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 22191                                  	;je	short got_installparm
 22192                                  	;jmp	short installfilename
 22193                                  	; 10/04/2024
 22194 00001029 75FB                    	jne	short installfilename
 22195                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22196 0000102B AC                      	lodsb
 22197 0000102C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22198 0000102F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22199 00001031 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22200 00001033 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22201 00001035 47                      	inc	di
 22202 00001036 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 22203                                  done_installparm:
 22204 00001038 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 22205 0000103D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 22206 00001040 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 22207 00001042 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 22208                                  					; starts with cr.
 22209                                  install_seg_set:
 22210 00001048 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 22211 0000104F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 22270 00001079 07                      	pop	es

 22272 0000107B 7306                            jnc     short install_exit_ret
 22273                                  
 22274 0000107D 56                      	push	si			; error in loading the file for install=.
 22275 0000107E E8C521                  	call	badload 		; es:si-> path,filename,0.
 22276 00001081 5E                      	pop	si
 22277                                  
 22278                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22279                                  	;jmp	short sysinitptr_retn ; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1140h)
 22280                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22281                                  	; ds = cs
 22282 00001082 C3                      	retn
 22283                                  
 22284                                  install_exit_ret:

 22288                                  ;SYSINIT:1142h:
 22289 00001083 B44D                    	mov     ah,4Dh
 22290 00001085 CD21                    	int     21h             ; DOS - 2+ - GET EXIT CODE OF SUBPROGRAM (WAIT)
 22291 00001087 80FC03                  	cmp     ah,3

 22298                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22299                                  
 22300                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22301                                  ;
 22302                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22303                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22304                                  ;
 22305                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22306                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22307                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22308                                  
 22309                                  ParaRound:
 22310 00001091 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22311 00001094 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22312 00001096 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22313 00001098 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22314 0000109A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22315 0000109C C3                      	retn
 22316                                  
 22317                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22318                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22319                                  ;
 22320                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22321                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22322                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22323                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22324                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22325                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22326                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22327                                  ;
 22328                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22329                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22330                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22331                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22332                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22333                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22334                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22335                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22336                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22337                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22338                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22339                                  ;
 22340                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22341                                  
 22342                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22343                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22344                                  sysinit_base:				
 22345 0000109D 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22346 000010A2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22347 000010A7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22348 000010A9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22349 000010AE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22350 000010B3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22351 000010B4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22352 000010B5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22353                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22354                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22355 000010B7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22356 000010BA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22357 000010BF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22358                                  
 22359                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22360                                  
 22361 000010C1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22362 000010C3 0E                      	push	cs
 22363 000010C4 1F                      	pop	ds
 22364 000010C5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22365 000010C8 CD21                    	int	21h
 22366                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22367                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22368                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22369                                  _stall: 
 22370                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22371 000010CA F4                      	hlt 
 22372                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22373                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22374 000010CB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22375                                  
 22376                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22377 000010CD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22378                                  
 22379                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22380                                  
 22381                                  sum_up:
 22382                                  
 22383                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22384                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22385                                  ;
 22386                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22387                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22388                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22389                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22390                                  ;
 22391                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22392                                  
 22393 000010D2 1E                      	push	ds
 22394                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22395                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22396 000010D3 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22397 000010D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22398 000010D9 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22399 000010DB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22400 000010DD 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22401                                  					;whole test better fail.
 22402 000010E2 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22403 000010E4 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22404                                  sum1:
 22405 000010E6 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22406 000010E8 46                      	inc	si
 22407 000010E9 46                      	inc	si
 22408 000010EA E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22409                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22410                                  sum_sys_code:
 22411                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22412 000010EC BEEC10                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22413                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22414                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22415                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22416                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22417                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22418                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 22419                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 22420 000010EF B9[D037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22421 000010F2 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22422 000010F4 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22423                                  sum2:
 22424 000010F6 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22425 000010F9 46                      	inc	si
 22426 000010FA 46                      	inc	si
 22427 000010FB E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22428 000010FD 1F                      	pop	ds
 22429 000010FE C3                      	retn
 22430                                  
 22431                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22432                                  
 22433                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22434                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 22435 000010FF 0000                    	dw	0
 22436                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22437                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:
 22438 00001101 0000                    	dw	0
 22439

 22446 0000110E 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 22457                                  ;

 22510 00001157 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22511                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 22512 0000115B C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0

 22514 00001160 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 22517 00001167 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22518                                  set_buff_2:
 22519 0000116A 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22520                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22521 0000116F 2E800E[FA13]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 22527                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22528                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22529                                  ;
 22530                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22531                                  ;
 22532                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22533                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 22538 00001178 53                      	push	bx

 22542                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22543 00001183 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22544                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22545                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22546                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22547 00001186 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22548 00001188 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22549 0000118A B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22550                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22551 0000118D CD2F                    	int	2Fh

 22553 00001192 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22554

 22556                                  	; 05/09/2023

 22559                                  	; zf=1
 22560                                  
 22561                                  	;zf=1
 22562                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22563                                  	;zf=1
 22564 00001195 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22565                                  got_hma:

 22567 0000119B 5B                      	pop	bx
 22568 0000119C C3                      	retn

 22598                                  ; ======================================================================
 22599                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22600                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22601                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22602                                  
 22603                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22604                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22605                                  ;
 22606                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22607                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22608                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22609                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22610                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22611                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22612                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22613                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22614                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22615                                  ;
 22616                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22617                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22618                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22619                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22620                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22621                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22622                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22623                                  ;	conditions:
 22624                                  ;
 22625                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22626                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22627                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22628                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22629                                  ;
 22630                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22631                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22632                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22633                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22636                                  ;
 22637                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22638                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22639                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22640                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22641                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22642                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22643                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22644                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22645                                  ;
 22646                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22647                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22648                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22649                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22650                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22651                                  ;
 22652                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22653                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22654                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22655                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22656                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22657                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22658                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22659                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22660                                  ;
 22661                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22662                                  
 22663                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22664                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22665                                  
 22666                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22667                                  stackinit:
 22668 000011C5 50                      	push	ax
 22669 000011C6 1E                      	push	ds
 22670 000011C7 06                      	push	es
 22671 000011C8 53                      	push	bx
 22672 000011C9 51                      	push	cx
 22673 000011CA 52                      	push	dx
 22674 000011CB 57                      	push	di
 22675 000011CC 56                      	push	si
 22676 000011CD 55                      	push	bp
 22677                                  
 22678                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22679                                  
 22680                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22681                                  	; ds = cs
 22682 000011CE A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22683 000011D1 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22684                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22685                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22686                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22687 000011D3 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22688                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22689 000011D7 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22690 000011DA 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22691                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22692 000011DE A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22693                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22694                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22695                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22696 000011E1 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22697                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22698 000011E5 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22699 000011E7 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22700                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22701                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22702                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22703 000011EA 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22704                                  
 22705                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22706                                  
 22707                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22708                                  
 22709                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22710                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22711                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22712 000011EE 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22713                                  
 22714                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22715                                  
 22716 000011F3 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22717                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22718                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22719                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22720 000011F6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22721 000011F8 01E8                    	add	ax,bp

 23505                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23506                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23507                                  
 23508                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23509                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23510                                  
 23511                                  new_init_loop:
 23512                                  
 23513                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23514                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23515                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23516                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23517                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23518                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23519                                  
 23520                                  ; 13/04/2024
 23521                                  %if 0
 23522                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23523                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23524                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23525                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23526                                  
 23527                                  	push	ds
 23528                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23529                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23530                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23531                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23532                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23533                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23534                                  	mov	[di],ax
 23535                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23536                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23537                                  	pop	ds
 23538                                  %else
 23539                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.1
 23540 000013B7 1E                      	push	ds
 23541 000013B8 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23542 000013BC 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23543 000013BF 50                      	push	ax
 23544 000013C0 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23545 000013C3 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23546 000013C5 50                      	push	ax
 23547 000013C6 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23548 000013C9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23549 000013CB 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 23550 000013CC 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23551 000013CE 58                      	pop	ax
 23552 000013CF 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23553 000013D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 23554                                  %endif
 23555 000013D3 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23556 000013D6 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23557 000013DA C3                      	retn
 23558                                  
 23559                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23596                                  	;pop	cx
 23597                                  	;pop	es
 23598                                  	
 23599 000013F1 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]

 23812                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23813                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23814 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23815 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23816 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23817                                  endstruc
 23818                                  
 23819                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23820                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23821                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23822                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23823                                  
 23824                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23825                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23826                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23827                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23828                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23829                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23830                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23831                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23832                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23833                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23834                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23835                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23836                                  
 23837                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23838                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23839 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23840 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23841 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23842                                  endstruc
 23843                                  
 23844                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23845                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23846                                  ;
 23847                                  ;
 23848                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23849                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23850                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23851                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23852                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23853                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23854                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23855                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23856                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23857                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23858                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23859                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23860                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23861                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23862                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23863                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23864                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23865                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23866                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23867                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23868                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23869                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23870                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23871                                  ;	   :
 23872                                  ;
 23873                                  ;Note:
 23874                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23875                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23876                                  ;
 23877                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23878                                  ;
 23879                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23880                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23881                                  ;
 23882                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23883                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23884                                  ;
 23885                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23886                                  ;
 23887                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23888                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23889                                  ;
 23890                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23891                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23892                                  ;
 23893                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23894                                  ;
 23895                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23896                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23897                                  ;
 23898                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23899                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23900                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23901                                  ;
 23902                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23903                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23904                                  ;
 23905                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23906                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23907                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23908                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23909                                  
 23910                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23911                                  
 23912                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23913                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23914                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23915                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23916                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23917                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23918                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23919                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23920                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23921                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23922                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23923                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23924                                  
 23925                                  ;**** Function flags
 23926                                  
 23927                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23928                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23929                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23930                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23931                                  
 23932                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23933                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23934 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23935 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23936 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23937 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23938 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23939 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23940                                  endstruc
 23941                                  
 23942                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23943                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23944                                  ;
 23945                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23946                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23947                                  ;	     +-
 23948                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23949                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23950                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23951                                  ;	     |	:
 23952                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23953                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23954                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23955                                  ;	     |	:
 23956                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23957                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23958                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23959                                  ;	     +-	:
 23960                                  ;
 23961                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23962                                  ;
 23963                                  ;Note:
 23964                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23965                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23966                                  ;
 23967                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23968                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23969                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23970                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23971                                  
 23972                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23973                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23974                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23975                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23976                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23977                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23978                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23979                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23980                                  
 23981                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23982 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23983 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23984 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23985 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23986 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23987                                  endstruc
 23988                                  
 23989                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23990                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23991                                  ;
 23992                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23993                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23994                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23995                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23996                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23997                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23998                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23999                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24000                                  ;
 24001                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24002                                  ;
 24003                                  ;            +-
 24004                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24005                                  ;	    | or
 24006                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24007                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24008                                  ;	    | or
 24009                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24010                                  ;	    | or
 24011                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24012                                  ;	    | or
 24013                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24014                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24015                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24016                                  ;	    | or
 24017                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24018                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24019                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24020                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24021                                  ;	    +-
 24022                                  ;
 24023                                  ;
 24024                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24025                                  ;      list.
 24026                                  ;
 24027                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24028                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24029                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24030                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24031                                  
 24032                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24033                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24034 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24035 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24036 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24037 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24038                                  endstruc

 24042

 24045                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 24046                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 24047                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 24048                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 24049                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24050                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24051                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24052                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 24053

 24055

 24057                                  ;

 24059

 24061                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24062                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24063                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24064                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24065                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24066                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24067                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24068                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24069                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24084                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags

 24149                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991

 24151                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24152                                  
 24153                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24154                                  ; SysParse;
 24155                                  ;
 24156                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24157                                  ;
 24158                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24159                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24160                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24161                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24162                                  ;
 24163                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24164                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24165                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24166                                  ;
 24167                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24168                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24169                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24170                                  ;
 24171                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24172                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24173                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24174                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24175                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24176                                  ;
 24177                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24178                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24179                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24180                                  ;
 24181                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24182                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24183                                  ;
 24184                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24185                                  ;
 24186                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24187                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24188                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24189                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24190                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24191                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24192                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24193                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24194                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24195                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24196                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24197                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24198                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24199                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24200                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24201                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24202                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24203                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24204                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24205                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24206                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24207                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24208                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24209                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24210                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24211                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24212                                  ;					  (tm14)

 24214                                  ;					  (tm15)

 24853                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24854                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24855                                  ;
 24856                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24857                                  ;
 24858                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24859                                  ;	    AL = type
 24860                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24861                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24862                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24863                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24864                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24865                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24866                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24867                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24868                                  ;
 24869                                  ; Output:   None
 24870                                  ;
 24871                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24872                                  ;
 24873                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24874                                  ;***********************************************************************

 25269                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25270                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25271                                  ;
 25272                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25273                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25274                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25275                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25276                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25277                                  ;
 25278                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25279                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25280                                  ;
 25281                                  ; Output:    None
 25282                                  ;
 25283                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25284                                  ;
 25285                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25286                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25287                                  
 25288                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25289                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25290                                  
 25291                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25292 00001866 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25293 00001867 2E800E[0D14]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25294 0000186D 2E8026[0D14]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25295 00001873 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25296 00001876 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25297 00001878 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25298                                  
 25299 0000187A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25300 0000187C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25301                                  
 25302 0000187E 2E800E[0D14]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25303                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25304 00001884 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25305                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25306 00001885 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25307 00001888 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25308 00001889 C3                      	retn
 25309                                  
 25310                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25311                                  
 25312                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25313                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25314 0000188A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25315 0000188B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25316 0000188C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25317 0000188D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25318 0000188E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25319 00001890 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25320 00001892 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25321                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25322 00001893 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25323 00001896 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25324 00001898 7442                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25325                                  
 25326 0000189A E8E600                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25327 0000189D 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25328                                  
 25329 0000189F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25330 000018A1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25331 000018A3 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25332 000018A5 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25333 000018A7 E8C700                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25334 000018AA 722C                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25335                                  
 25336 000018AC 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25337 000018AE 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25338 000018B0 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25339 000018B2 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25340 000018B4 E8BA00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25341 000018B7 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25342                                  
 25343 000018B9 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25344 000018BB D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25345 000018BD E8B100                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
