 25522                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25523                                  ;
 25524                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25525                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25526                                  ;
 25527                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25528                                  ;
 25529                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25530                                  ;
 25531                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25532                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25533                                  
 25534                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25535                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25536 00001971 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25537 00001972 2EF606[0D14]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25538 00001978 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25539                                  
 25540 0000197A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25541 0000197B C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25542                                  
 25543                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25544 0000197C 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25545 0000197D 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25546                                  
 25547 0000197F F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25548 00001980 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25549                                  
 25550                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25551                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 25552 00001981 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25553                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 25554 00001982 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26162                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26163                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26164                                  ;
 26165                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26166                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26167                                  ;	    blanks.
 26168                                  ;
 26169                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26170                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26171                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26172                                  ;
 26173                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26174                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26175                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26176                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26177                                  
 26178                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26179 00001BB1 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26180 00001BB2 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26181 00001BB3 2EC606[0714]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26182                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26183                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26184 00001BB9 2E8026[0D14]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;

 26187

 26193

 26195                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26196                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 14/08/2023
 26197                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26198                                  %if 0
 26199                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26200                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26201                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?

 26209                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF

 26215                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26216 00001BD0 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26217

 26219 00001BD2 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26220                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26221 00001BD4 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26222                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26223                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26224                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;

 26226 00001BD8 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ

 26259                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26260                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26261                                  ;
 26262                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26263                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26264                                  ;
 26265                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26266                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26267                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26268                                  ;
 26269                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26270                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26271                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26272                                  
 26273                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26274                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26275                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26276                                  ;
 26277                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26278                                  
 26279                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26280                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26281                                  
 26282                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26283                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26284                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26285                                  	; 14/08/2023
 26286 00001BFF BD[1614]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26287                                  
 26288                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26289 00001C02 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26290 00001C04 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26291                                  
 26292                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26293 00001C06 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26294 00001C08 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26295                                  
 26296 00001C0A F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26297                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26298                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26299 00001C0B C3                      	retn
 26300                                  
 26301                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26302                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26303                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26304                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26305                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26306                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26307                                  
 26308                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26309                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26310 00001C0C 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26311 00001C0E 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26312                                  
 26313 00001C10 2E800E[0D14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26314                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26315                                  
 26316                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26317                                  	; cf=0
 26318                                  	;retn
 26319                                  
 26320                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26321                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26322                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26323 00001C16 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26324                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26325                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26326 00001C17 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26332                                  ;

 26338                                  ;

 26355 00001C25 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26356 00001C26 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26357 00001C27 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26358 00001C28 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26359 00001C29 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26360 00001C2A 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26361                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 26362                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;

 26366                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26367 00001C32 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26368 00001C34 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26369 00001C36 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;

 26379 00001C44 2E891E[0A14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26380                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26381                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset

 26385                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26386 00001C4E 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?

 26396 00001C60 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg

 26959                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26960                                  
 26961                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26962                                  
 26963                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26964                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26965                                  
 26966                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26967                                  ;
 26968                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26969                                  ;
 26970                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26971                                  ;
 26972                                  ;   Modification log:
 26973                                  ;
 26974                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26975                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26976                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26977                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26978                                  ;
 26979                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26980                                  ;
 26981                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26982                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26983                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26984                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26985                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26986                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26987                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26988                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26989                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26990                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26991                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26992                                  ;
 26993                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26994                                  
 26995                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26996                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26997                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26998                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26999                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27000                                  
 27001                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27002                                  
 27003                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27004                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27005                                  
 27006                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27007                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27008                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27009                                  
 27010                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27011                                  ;
 27012                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27013                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27014                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27015                                  ;	           line.
 27016                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27017                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27018                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27019                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27020                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27021                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27022                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27023                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27024                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27025                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27026                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27027                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27028                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27029                                  ;	           for details).
 27030                                  
 27031                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 27032                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 27033                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 27034                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 27035                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27036                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27037                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 27038                                  fm_strat: db	0
 27039                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 27040                                  
 27041                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27042                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27043                                  
 27044                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27045                                  
 27046                                  %endif
 27047                                  
 27048                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 27049                                  
 27050                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 27051                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 27052                                  
 27053                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27054                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27055                                  
 27056                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27057                                  
 27058 00001E4A 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 27059 00001E4C 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27060 00001E4E 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27061 00001E50 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27062 00001E54 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27063                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 27064                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 27065                                  ;
 27066 00001E58 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 27067 00001E59 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 27068 00001E5B 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 27069 00001E5D 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 27070                                  ;
 27071 00001E5F 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 27072                                  ;
 27073 00001E63 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 27074 00001E65 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 27075                                  ;
 27076 00001E67 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 27077                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 27078 00001E68 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 27079                                  ;
 27080 00001E6A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 27081 00001E6B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 27082 00001E6D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 27083                                  ;
 27084 00001E75 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 27085 00001E76 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 27086 00001E78 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 27087 00001E7C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 27088                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 27089                                  ;
 27090                                  ;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 27091                                  ;MagicHomeFlag:	db	0	; set non-zero when MagicDrv is final placed
 27092                                  ;	endif

 27096                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 27099                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 27100                                  
 27101                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27102                                  ;
 27103                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27104                                  ;
 27105                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27106                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27107                                  ;
 27108                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27109                                  
 27110                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27111                                  doconf:
 27112 00001E7D 0E                      	push	cs
 27113 00001E7E 1F                      	pop	ds
 27114                                  
 27115 00001E7F B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27116                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27117 00001E82 CD21                    	int	21h
 27118 00001E84 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27119                                  
 27120                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27121                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27122                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27123                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27124                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27125                                  
 27126 00001E88 BA[EB32]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 27127 00001E8B B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27128                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 27129 00001E8E F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27130 00001E8F CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27131 00001E91 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27132                                  
 27133                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27134                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27135                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27136                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27137                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27138 00001E93 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27139 00001E98 C3                      	retn
 27140                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27141 00001E99 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27142 00001E9B 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27143 00001E9D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27144                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27145 00001E9F B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27146 00001EA2 CD21                    	int	21h
 27147 00001EA4 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 27148                                  
 27149 00001EA7 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27150                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27151 00001EA9 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27152 00001EAC CD21                    	int	21h
 27153                                  
 27154                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27155                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27156 00001EAE 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27157                                  
 27158 00001EB2 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27159 00001EB5 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27160 00001EB8 E8D6F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27161 00001EBB 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27162                                  
 27163                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27164                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27165                                  ;;
 27166                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27167                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27168                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27169                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27170                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27171                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27172                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27173                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27174                                  ;;
 27175                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27176                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27177                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27178                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27179                                  
 27180 00001EBD 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27181                                  	
 27182                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27183                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27184                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27185 00001EC0 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27186 00001EC4 E8F1EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 27187                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27188                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27189 00001EC7 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27190                                   
 27191 00001ECC 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27192 00001ECE 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27193                                  
 27194 00001ED0 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27195 00001ED2 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27196 00001ED7 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27197                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27198 00001ED9 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27199 00001EDA CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27200 00001EDC 9C                      	pushf
 27201                                  
 27202                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27203                                  
 27204 00001EDD 50                      	push	ax
 27205 00001EDE 57                      	push	di
 27206 00001EDF 51                      	push	cx
 27207 00001EE0 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27208 00001EE2 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27209 00001EE4 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27210 00001EE6 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27211 00001EE8 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27212                                  
 27213                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27214                                  
 27215 00001EEA 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27216                                  
 27217                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27218                                  
 27219                                  puteol:
 27220 00001EEB B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27221 00001EED AA                      	stosb
 27222 00001EEE B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27223 00001EF0 AA                      	stosb
 27224 00001EF1 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27225                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27226                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27227                                  
 27228                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27229                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27230 00001EF3 0E                      	push	cs
 27231 00001EF4 1F                      	pop	ds
 27232                                  
 27233 00001EF5 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27234                                  
 27235 00001EF9 59                      	pop	cx
 27236 00001EFA 5F                      	pop	di
 27237 00001EFB 58                      	pop	ax
 27238                                  
 27239                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27240                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27241                                  	;push	cs
 27242                                  	;pop	ds
 27243                                  
 27244 00001EFC 50                      	push	ax
 27245                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27246 00001EFD B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27247 00001EFF CD21                    	int	21h
 27248 00001F01 58                      	pop	ax
 27249 00001F02 9D                      	popf
 27250 00001F03 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 27251 00001F05 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 27252 00001F07 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27253                                  conferr:
 27254 00001F09 BA[EB32]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 27255 00001F0C E83313                  	call	badfil
 27256                                  endconv:
 27257 00001F0F C3                      	retn
 27258                                  
 27259                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27260                                  ;
 27261                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27262                                  ;
 27263                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 27264                                  ;
 27265                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27266                                  
 27267                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27268                                  multi_pass:
 27269 00001F10 0E                      	push	cs
 27270 00001F11 1F                      	pop	ds
 27271                                  
 27272 00001F12 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27273                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27274 00001F17 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27275                                  
 27276                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 27277                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27278 00001F19 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27279 00001F1D 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 27280                                  
 27281 00001F1E 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27282 00001F22 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27283 00001F26 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 27284 00001F28 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 27285 00001F2C 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 27286                                  
 27287 00001F30 E89310                  	call	getchr
 27288 00001F33 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 27289                                  
 27290                                  getcom:
 27291 00001F35 E8770E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 27292 00001F38 E88B10                  	call	getchr
 27293                                  conflp: 
 27294 00001F3B 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 27295                                  
 27296 00001F3D FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 27297                                  
 27298 00001F41 C606[F713]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27299 00001F46 C606[FA13]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27300 00001F4B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27301 00001F4D 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27302                                  
 27303                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27304                                  %if 0
 27305                                  
 27306                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27307                                  
 27308                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27309                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27310                                  
 27311                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27312                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27313                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27314                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27315                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27316                                  
 27317                                          push    ax                      ;
 27318                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27319                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27320                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27321                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27322                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27323                                          pop     ax
 27324                                  ;
 27325                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27326                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27327                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27328                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27329                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27330                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27331                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27332                                  ;   spot.
 27333                                  ;
 27334                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27335                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27336                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27337                                  ;   retrieved.
 27338                                  ;
 27339                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27340                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 27341                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27342                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27343                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27344                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27345                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 27346                                  final:                                  ;
 27347                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27348                                  not_final:                              ;
 27349                                  ;endif
 27350                                  
 27351                                  %endif
 27352 00001F4F 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27353 00001F51 E87210                  	call	getchr
 27354 00001F54 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27355                                  
 27356 00001F56 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27357                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27358                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27359 00001F5B 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27360 00001F5D E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 27361                                  	
 27362                                  coff:	
 27363                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27364                                  	; ds = cs
 27365                                  	;push	cs
 27366                                  	;pop	ds
 27367 00001F60 E85A10                  	call	newline
 27368 00001F63 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 27369                                  
 27370                                  blank_line:
 27371 00001F65 E85E10                  	call	getchr
 27372 00001F68 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 27373                                  
 27374                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27375                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27376                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27377                                  ;coff_p:
 27378                                  	;push	cs
 27379                                  	;pop	ds
 27380                                  
 27381                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27382                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27383                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27384                                  ;install= command.
 27385                                  
 27386                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27387                                  ;install command
 27388                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27389                                  
 27390                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27391                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27392                                  tryi:
 27393 00001F6A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27394 00001F6F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 27395 00001F71 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 27396                                  not_init_pass:
 27397 00001F74 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27398                                          ; 11/12/2022
 27399                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 27400 00001F79 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27401                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27402                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27403                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27404                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27405                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27406                                  					; and before install= commands
 27407                                  					; are processed
 27408                                  
 27409 00001F7B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27410 00001F80 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27411 00001F82 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27412                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27413                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27414 00001F85 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27415                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27416                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27417                                  
 27418                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27419                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27420                                          
 27421 00001F87 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27422                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 27423                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27424 00001F8A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 27425                                  	
 27426                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 27427 00001F8C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27428                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 27429 00001F91 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 27430                                  
 27431                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27432                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 27433                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 27434                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 27435                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27436                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27437                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 27438                                  
 27439                                  multi_try_i:
 27440 00001F93 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 27441                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 27442                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27443 00001F96 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27444                                  
 27445                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27446                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27447                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27448                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27449                                  ;;endif
 27450                                  
 27451 00001F98 E878F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 27452 00001F9B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 27453                                  
 27454                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27455                                  %if 0
 27456                                  
 27457                                  multi_try_n:
 27458                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 27459                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 27460                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27461                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27462                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27463                                  ;endif
 27464                                  
 27465                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27466                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27467                                  
 27468                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27469                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27470                                  	mov	bx,ax
 27471                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27472                                  
 27473                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 27474                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27475                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27476                                  
 27477                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 27478                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 27479                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 27480                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 27481

 27489                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 27490                                          int     21h
 27491                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 27492                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 27493                                          int     21h

 27495                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 27496                                  
 27497                                  %endif

 27519                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27520                                  ;									      *
 27521                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27522                                  ;									      *
 27523                                  ; input :								      *
 27524                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27525                                  ; output:								      *
 27526                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27527                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27528                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27529                                  ;									      *

 27545                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27546                                  ;	};								      *

 27548                                  ; };									      *
 27549                                  ;									      *

 28881                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28882                                  ; function: parse the parameters of files= command.			      *
 28883                                  ;									      *
 28884                                  ; input :								      *
 28885                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 28886                                  ; output:								      *
 28887                                  ;	variable files set.						      *
 28888                                  ;									      *
 28889                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 28890                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *

 28892                                  ; {									      *
 28893                                  ;	set di points to files_parms;					      *
 28894                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 28895                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 28896                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *

 28898                                  ;	     files = result_val._$P_picked_val				      *

 28960                                  ;******************************************************************************

 28981                                  ; };									      *

 28983                                  ;******************************************************************************

 29065                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29066                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29067                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29068                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29069                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29070                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29071                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29072                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29073                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29074                                  
 29075                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29076                                  ;									  *
 29077                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29078                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29079                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29080                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29081                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29082                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29083                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29084                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29085                                  ; input :								  *
 29086                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29087                                  ; output:								  *
 29088                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29089                                  ;									  *
 29090                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29091                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29092                                  ; logic:								  *
 29093                                  ; {									  *
 29094                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29095                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29096                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29097                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29098                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29099                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29100                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29101                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29102                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29103                                  ;	     }								  *
 29104                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29105                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29106                                  ;	};								  *
 29107                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29108                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29109                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29110                                  ; };									  *
 29111                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29112

 29781                                  
 29782                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29783                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29784                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29785                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29786                                  ;
 29787                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29788                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29789                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29790                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29791                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29792                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29793                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29794                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29795                                  ;	 procedure.
 29796                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29797                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29798                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal

 30187                                  ;

 30189                                  ;	Output : none

 30192                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30193                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30194                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13

 30204                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it

 30302                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30303                                  
 30304                                  %if 0
 30305                                  
 30306                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30307                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30308                                  
 30309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30310                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30311                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30312                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30313                                  
 30314                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30315                                  ;
 30316                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30317                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30318                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30319                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30320                                  ;
 30321                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30322                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30323                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30324                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30325                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30326                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30327                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30328                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30329                                  ; available during the load.
 30330                                  ;
 30331                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30332                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30333                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30334                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30335                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30336                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30337                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30338                                  ;
 30339                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30340                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30341                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30342                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30343                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30344                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30345                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30346                                  ;
 30347                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30348                                  
 30349                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30350                                  
 30351                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30352                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30353                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30354                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30355                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30356                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30357                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30358                                  
 30359                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30360                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30361                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30362                                  
 30363                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30364                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30365                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30366                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30367                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30368                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30369                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30370                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30371                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 30372                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30373                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30374                                  
 30375                                  InitVar:
 30376                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30377                                  	push	ax
 30378                                  	push	cx
 30379                                  	push	di
 30380                                  	push	es
 30381                                  
 30382                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30383                                  	push	cs
 30384                                  	pop	es
 30385                                  
 30386                                  	xor	ax,ax
 30387                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30388                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30389                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30390                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30391                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30392                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30393                                  
 30394                                  	cld
 30395                                  
 30396                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30397                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30398                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30399                                  
 30400                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30401                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30402                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30403                                  
 30404                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30405                                  
 30406                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30407                                  	pop	es
 30408                                  	pop	di
 30409                                  	pop	cx
 30410                                  	pop	ax	 	
 30411                                  
 30412                                  	retn
 30413                                  
 30414                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30415                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30416                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30417                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30418                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30419                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30420                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30421                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30422                                  
 30423                                  FixMem:
 30424                                  	push	ax
 30425                                  	push	bx
 30426                                  	push	cx
 30427                                  	push	dx
 30428                                  	push	es
 30429                                  
 30430                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30431                                  
 30432                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30433                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30434                                  
 30435                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30436                                  
 30437                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30438                                  
 30439                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30440                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30441                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30442                                  
 30443                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30444                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30445                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30446                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30447                                  
 30448                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30449                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30450                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30451                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30452                                  
 30453                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30454                                  
 30455                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30456                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30457                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30458                                  
 30459                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30460                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30461                                  	; 14/08/2023
 30462                                  	inc	bx
 30463                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30464                                  
 30465                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30466                                  
 30467                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30468                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30469                                  
 30470                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30471                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30472                                  	inc	bx
 30473                                  	mov	es,bx
 30474                                  
 30475                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30476                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30477                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30478                                  fmX:	
 30479                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30480                                  
 30481                                  	pop	es
 30482                                  	pop	dx
 30483                                  	pop	cx
 30484                                  	pop	bx
 30485                                  	pop	ax
 30486                                  
 30487                                  	retn
 30488                                  
 30489                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30490                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30491                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30492                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30493                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30494                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30495                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30496                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30497                                  
 30498                                  fm_link:
 30499                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30500                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30501                                  
 30502                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30503                                  	;
 30504                                  	;push	es
 30505                                  	;push	cs
 30506                                  	;pop	es
 30507                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30508                                  	;pop	es
 30509                                  	
 30510                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30511                                  
 30512                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30513                                  	mov	bx,1
 30514                                  	int	21h
 30515                                  	retn
 30516                                  
 30517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30518                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30519                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30520                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30521                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30522                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30523                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30525                                  
 30526                                  fm_unlink:
 30527                                  	xor	bx,bx
 30528                                  	
 30529                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30530                                  	;
 30531                                  	;push	ds
 30532                                  	;push	cs
 30533                                  	;pop	ds
 30534                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30535                                  	;pop	ds
 30536                                  	
 30537                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30538                                  
 30539                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30540                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30541                                  	retn
 30542                                  
 30543                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30544                                  
 30545                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30546                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30547                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30548                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30549                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30550                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30551                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30552                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30553                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30554                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30555                                  ;
 30556                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30557                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30558                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30559                                  ;
 30560                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30561                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30562                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30563                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30564                                  ;
 30565                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30566                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30567                                  ;
 30568                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30569                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30570                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30571                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30572                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30573                                  ;     lh
 30574                                  ;     /l
 30575                                  ;     1
 30576                                  ;     1000
 30577                                  ;     2
 30578                                  ;     print
 30579                                  ;     /d
 30580                                  ;     :lpt2
 30581                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30582                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30583                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30584                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30585                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30586                                  ; for:
 30587                                  ;    Each /L
