 30588                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30589                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30590                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30591                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30592                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30593                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30594                                  
 30595                                  ParseVar:
 30596                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30597                                  	push	di
 30598                                  	push	ds
 30599                                  	push	es
 30600                                  
 30601                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30602                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30603                                  	cld
 30604                                  
 30605                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30606                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30607                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30608                                  
 30609                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30610                                  	call	isWhite
 30611                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30612                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30613                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30614                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30615                                  
 30616                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30617                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30618                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30619                                  
 30620                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30621                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30622                                  	and	al,0DFh
 30623                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30624                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30625                                  	jne	short pv30
 30626                                  
 30627                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30628                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30629                                  
 30630                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30631                                  	;
 30632                                  	;push	es
 30633                                  	;push	cs
 30634                                  	;pop	es
 30635                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30636                                  	;pop	es
 30637                                  
 30638                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30639                                  
 30640                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30641                                  
 30642                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30643                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30644                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30645                                  
 30646                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30647                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30648                                  
 30649                                  	call	parseL
 30650                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30651                                  
 30652                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30653                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30654                                  
 30655                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30656                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30657                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 30658                                  	dec	si
 30659                                  	stc
 30660                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30661                                  	pop	es
 30662                                  	pop	ds
 30663                                  	pop	di
 30664                                  	retn
 30665                                  
 30666                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30667                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30668                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30669                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30670                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30671                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30672                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30673                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30674                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30675                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30676                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30677                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30678                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30679                                  
 30680                                  parseL:
 30681                                  	lodsb
 30682                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30683                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30684                                  
 30685                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30686                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30687                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30688                                  
 30689                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30690                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30691                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30692                                  
 30693                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30694                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30695                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30696                                  
 30697                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30698                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30699                                  
 30700                                  	lodsb
 30701                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30702                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30703                                  
 30704                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30705                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30706                                  
 30707                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30708                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30709                                  
 30710                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30711                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30712                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30713                                  
 30714                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30715                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30716                                  
 30717                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30718                                  
 30719                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30720                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30721                                  
 30722                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30723                                  
 30724                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30725                                  
 30726                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30727                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30728                                  
 30729                                  	lodsb
 30730                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30731                                  	je	short pl10	;
 30732                                  
 30733                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30734                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30735                                  
 30736                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30737                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30738                                  
 30739                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30740                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30741                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30742                                  plE1:	
 30743                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30744                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30745                                  	dec	si
 30746                                  	stc
 30747                                  	retn
 30748                                  
 30749                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30750                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30751                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30752                                  	; cf=1
 30753                                  	;stc
 30754                                  	retn
 30755                                  plSwX:	
 30756                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30757                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30758                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30759                                  	; cf=0
 30760                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30761                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30762                                  
 30763                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30764                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 30765                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30766                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30767                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30768                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30769                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 30770                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30771                                  
 30772                                  ;incArgc:
 30773                                  	;push	ax
 30774                                  
 30775                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 30776                                  
 30777                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 30778                                  
 30779                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 30780                                  
 30781                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 30782                                  
 30783                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 30784                                  
 30785                                  	;pop	ax
 30786                                  	;retn
 30787                                  
 30788                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30789                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30790                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30791                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30792                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30793                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30794                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30795                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30796                                  
 30797                                  isEOL:
 30798                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 30799                                  	je	short ieX
 30800                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30801                                  	je	short ieX
 30802                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 30803                                  ieX:	
 30804                                  	retn
 30805                                  
 30806                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30807                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30808                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30809                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30810                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 30811                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30812                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30813                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30814                                  
 30815                                  isWhite:
 30816                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 30817                                  	je	short iwX
 30818                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 30819                                  	je	short iwX
 30820                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 30821                                  iwX:	
 30822                                  	retn
 30823                                  
 30824                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30825                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 30826                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30827                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 30828                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30829                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30830                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30831                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30832                                  
 30833                                  unMarkUMB:
 30834                                  	push	ax
 30835                                  	push	bx
 30836                                  	push	di
 30837                                  	push	es
 30838                                  
 30839                                  	push	cs
 30840                                  	pop	es
 30841                                  
 30842                                  	xor	ah,ah
 30843                                  	mov	bx,ax
 30844                                  
 30845                                  	; 19/04/2019
 30846                                  	
 30847                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 30848                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 30849                                  
 30850                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 30851                                  	jne	short umu10
 30852                                  
 30853                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 30854                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 30855                                  umu10:	
 30856                                  	pop	es
 30857                                  	pop	di
 30858                                  	pop	bx
 30859                                  	pop	ax
 30860                                  	retn
 30861                                  
 30862                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30863                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30864                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30865                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30866                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30867                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30868                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30869                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30870                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30871                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30872                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30873                                  
 30874                                  stowUMB:
 30875                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 30876                                  	jb	short su10
 30877                                  	stc
 30878                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 30879                                  su10:	
 30880                                  	push	bx
 30881                                  	push	di
 30882                                  	push	si
 30883                                  	push	ds
 30884                                  	push	es
 30885                                  	push	cs
 30886                                  	pop	es
 30887                                  	push	cs
 30888                                  	pop	ds
 30889                                  	
 30890                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 30891                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 30892                                  	jne	short su20
 30893                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30894                                  su20:	
 30895                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 30896                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 30897                                  
 30898                                  	mov	bl,al
 30899                                  	xor	bh,bh
 30900                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 30901                                  
 30902                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30903                                  
 30904                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 30905                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 30906                                  
 30907                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 30908                                  su30:	
 30909                                  	pop	es
 30910                                  	pop	ds
 30911                                  	pop	si
 30912                                  	pop	di
 30913                                  	pop	bx
 30914                                  	retn
 30915                                  
 30916                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30917                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 30918                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30919                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 30920                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30921                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30922                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30923                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30924                                  
 30925                                  ; 13/05/2019
 30926                                  
 30927                                  stowSiz:
 30928                                  	push	bx
 30929                                  	;push	di ; ?
 30930                                  	push	es
 30931                                  
 30932                                  	push	cs
 30933                                  	pop	es	
 30934                                  
 30935                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 30936                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 30937                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 30938                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 30939                                  	
 30940                                  	pop	es
 30941                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 30942                                  	pop	bx
 30943                                  
 30944                                  	retn
 30945                                  
 30946                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30947                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 30948                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 30949                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 30950                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 30951                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30952                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 30953                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 30954                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 30955                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 30956                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30957                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30958                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30959                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30960                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30961                                  
 30962                                  gnradix:
 30963                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 30964                                  
 30965                                  toDigit:
 30966                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30967                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 30968                                  
 30969                                  toDigit_hex:
 30970                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 30971                                  	jb	short td10
 30972                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 30973                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 30974                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 30975                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30976                                  	retn
 30977                                  td10:	
 30978                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 30979                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 30980                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 30981                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 30982                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 30983                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30984                                  	retn
 30985                                  toDigit_dec:
 30986                                  td20:	
 30987                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30988                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30989                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30990                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30991                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30992                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30993                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30994                                  	retn
 30995                                  tdE:	
 30996                                  	stc
 30997                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30998                                  	retn
 30999                                  
 31000                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31001                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31002                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31003                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31004                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31005                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31006                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31007                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31008                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31009                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31010                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31011                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31012                                  
 31013                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31014                                  
 31015                                  GetXNum:
 31016                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31017                                  	push	bx
 31018                                  	push	cx
 31019                                  	push	ds
 31020                                  
 31021                                  	cld
 31022                                  	xor	ax,ax
 31023                                  	xor	bx,bx
 31024                                  	xor	cx,cx
 31025                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31026                                  
 31027                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31028                                  
 31029                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31030                                  	;call	toDigit
 31031                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31032                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31033                                  
 31034                                  	or	cl,cl
 31035                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31036                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31037                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31038                                  	je	short gxn10
 31039                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31040                                  	jne	short gxn20
 31041                                  
 31042                                  gxn10:	
 31043                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31044                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31045                                  	inc	si
 31046                                  
 31047                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31048                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31049                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31050                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31051                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31052                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31053                                  
 31054                                  gxn20:	
 31055                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31056                                  	inc	si
 31057                                  
 31058                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31059                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31060                                  
 31061                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31062                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31063                                  
 31064                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31065                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31066                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31067                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31068                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 31069                                  gxnE:	
 31070                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31071                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31072                                  gxnQ:	
 31073                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31074                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31075                                  gxnX:	
 31076                                  	pop	ds
 31077                                  	pop	cx
 31078                                  	pop	bx
 31079                                  	retn
 31080                                  
 31081                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31082                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31084                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31085                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31086                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31087                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31088                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31089                                  
 31090                                  mul32:
 31091                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31092                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31093                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31094                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31095                                  
 31096                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31097                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31098                                  
 31099                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31100                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31101                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31102                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31103                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31104                                  	retn
 31105                                  m32E:	
 31106                                  	pop	ax
 31107                                  	retn
 31108                                  
 31109                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31110                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31111                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31112                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31113                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31114                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31115                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31116                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31117                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31118                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31119                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31120                                  
 31121                                  toPara:
 31122                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31123                                  
 31124                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 31125                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31126                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31127                                  	mov	cl,12
 31128                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31129                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31130                                  
 31131                                  	pop	cx
 31132                                  	retn
 31133                                  
 31134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31135                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31136                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31137                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31138                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31139                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31140                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31141                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31142                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31143                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31144                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31145                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31146                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31147                                  
 31148                                  UmbHead:
 31149                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 31150                                  
 31151                                  	;push	si ; ?
 31152                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 31153                                  	;push	es
 31154                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 31155                                  
 31156                                  	; 09/04/2019
 31157                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 31158                                  
 31159                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31160                                  	int	21h
 31161                                  
 31162                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31163                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31164                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 31165                                  
 31166                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 31167                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 31168                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31169                                  	retn
 31170                                  uhE:	
 31171                                  	stc
 31172                                  uhX:	
 31173                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 31174                                  	;pop	es
 31175                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 31176                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 31177                                  	retn
 31178                                  
 31179                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31180                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 31181                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31182                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 31183                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 31184                                  ; USES:   Flags
 31185                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31186                                  
 31187                                  isSysMCB:
 31188                                  	;push	ax
 31189                                  
 31190                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 31191                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 31192                                  	;je	short ism10
 31193                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 31194                                  	;;je	short ism10
 31195                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 31196                                  	;jne	short ismX
 31197                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 31198                                  	jne	short ismX 
 31199                                  ism10:	
 31200                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 31201                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 31202                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 31203                                  ismX:	
 31204                                  	;pop	ax
 31205                                  	retn
 31206                                  
 31207                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31208                                  
 31209                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31210                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 31211                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31212                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 31213                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 31214                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 31215                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31216                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31217                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 31218                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 31219                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 31220                                  ;      ...
 31221                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 31222                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31223                                  
 31224                                  AddrToUmb:
 31225                                  	push	cx
 31226                                  	push	dx
 31227                                  	push	es
 31228                                  
 31229                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 31230                                  
 31231                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 31232                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 31233                                  
 31234                                  	; 14/08/2023
 31235                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 31236                                  	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 31237                                  
 31238                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31239                                  atu10:
 31240                                  	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 14/08/2023
 31241                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31242                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 31243                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 31244                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 31245                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31246                                  
 31247                                  ;atu10:	
 31248                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 14/08/2023
 31249                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 31250                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 31251                                  
 31252                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 31253                                  	jnz	short atu20
 31254                                  
 31255                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31256                                  atu20:	
 31257                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31258                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31259                                  	; 14/08/2023
 31260                                  	; ax = es
 31261                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31262                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31263                                  	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31264                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31265                                  
 31266                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31267                                  
 31268                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31269                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31270                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31271                                  	inc	ax
 31272                                  	; 14/08/2023
 31273                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31274                                  	jmp	short atu10
 31275                                  
 31276                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31277                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31278                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31279                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31280                                  
 31281                                  atu30:	
 31282                                  	; 14/08/2023
 31283                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31284                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31285                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31286                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31287                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31288                                  atuE:	
 31289                                  	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31290                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31291                                  atuX:	
 31292                                  	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31293                                  	
 31294                                  	pop	es	
 31295                                  	pop	dx
 31296                                  	pop	cx
 31297                                  	retn
 31298                                  
 31299                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31300                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31301                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31302                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31303                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31304                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31305                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31306                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 31307                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31308                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31310                                  
 31311                                  convUMB:
 31312                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31313                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 31314                                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 31315                                  ;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31316                                  	;jne	short cu10
 31317                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31318                                  	; 14/08/2023
 31319                                  	inc	ax
 31320                                  	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31321                                  	dec	ax
 31322                                  cu10:	
 31323                                  	retn
 31324                                  
 31325                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31326                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 31327                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 31328                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 31329                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31330                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31331                                  ; EXIT:   None
 31332                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31333                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31334                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31335                                  
 31336                                  setUMBs:
 31337                                  	push	ax
 31338                                  	push	bx
 31339                                  	call	fm_link
 31340                                  	pop	bx
 31341                                  	pop	ax
 31342                                  	retn
 31343                                  
 31344                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31345                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 31346                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31347                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31348                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 31349                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 31350                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31351                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 31352                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31353                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 31354                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 31355                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 31356                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 31357                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31358                                  
 31359                                  loadLow:
 31360                                  	;push	ds
 31361                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 31362                                  	;pop	ds	
 31363                                  
 31364                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 31365                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 31366                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 31367                                  	jne	short ll10
 31368                                  
 31369                                  	stc
 31370                                  ll15:
 31371                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 31372                                  	;stc
 31373                                  	;jmp	short llX
 31374                                  	retn
 31375                                  ll10:	
 31376                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 31377                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 31378                                  
 31379                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31380                                  	retn
 31381                                  
 31382                                  	;mov	al,1
 31383                                  	;clc
 31384                                  ;llX:
 31385                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 31386                                  	;retn
 31387                                  
 31388                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31389                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 31390                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31391                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31392                                  ; EXIT:   None
 31393                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31394                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 31395                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31396                                  
 31397                                  HideUMBs:
 31398                                  	push	ax
 31399                                  	push	cx
 31400                                  	push	ds
 31401                                  	push	es
 31402                                  
 31403                                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 31404                                  	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 31405                                  
 31406                                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 31407                                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 31408                                  
 31409                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 31410                                  	mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 31411                                  
 31412                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 31413                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31414                                  
 31415                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 31416                                  	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 31417                                  
 31418                                  	xor	cx,cx
 31419                                  
 31420                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 31421                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 31422                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 31423                                  
 31424                                  hus10:	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 31425                                  	cmp	cx,MAXUMB ; 16
 31426                                  	jae	short hus20
 31427                                  
 31428                                  	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 31429                                  	push	es
 31430                                  	call	findUMB		; valid range of UMBs)
 31431                                  	pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 31432                                  	jc	short hus20
 31433                                  
 31434                                  	call	_hideUMB_	; hide what we need to hide.
 31435                                  
 31436                                  	jmp	short hus10
 31437                                  hus20:	
 31438                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 31439                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31440                                  
 31441                                  	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 31442                                  	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 31443                                  
 31444                                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 31445                                  husX:	
 31446                                  	pop	es
 31447                                  	pop	ds
 31448                                  	pop	cx
 31449                                  	pop	ax
 31450                                  	retn
 31451                                  
 31452                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31453                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 31454                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31455                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31456                                  ; EXIT:   AL == load UMB
 31457                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31458                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31459                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31460                                  
 31461                                  ;GetLoadUMB:

 31463                                  ;	push	ds
 31464                                  ;	push	cs
 31465                                  ;	pop	ds
 31466                                  ;	mov	al,[UmLoad]

 31469                                  
 31470                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31471                                  ;*** GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 31472                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31473                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31474                                  ; EXIT:   AX == load UMB minimum size
 31475                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31476                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31477                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31478                                  
 31479                                  GetLoadSize:
 31480                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31481                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 31482                                  	jmp	short GetSize
 31483                                  
 31484                                  	;push	bx
 31485                                  	;;push	si
 31486                                  	;push	ds
 31487                                  	;push	cs
 31488                                  	;pop	ds
 31489                                  
 31490                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 31491                                  
 31492                                  	;xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 31493                                  	;mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 31494                                  	;shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 31495                                  	;;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 31496                                  	;;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 31497                                  
 31498                                  	;;lodsw				;    ax==size
 31499                                  
 31500                                  	;add	bx,ax
 31501                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 31502                                  
 31503                                  	;pop	ds
 31504                                  	;;pop	si
 31505                                  	;pop	bx
 31506                                  	;retn
 31507                                  
 31508                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31509                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 31510                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31511                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 31512                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 31513                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31514                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31515                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31516                                  
 31517                                  GetSize:
 31518                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31519                                  
 31520                                  	push	bx
 31521                                  	;push	si
 31522                                  	;push	ds
 31523                                  	;push	cs
 31524                                  	;pop	ds
 31525                                  
 31526                                  	xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 31527                                  	mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 31528                                  	shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 31529                                  	;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 31530                                  	;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 31531                                  
 31532                                  	;lodsw				;    ax==size
 31533                                  
 31534                                  	add	bx,ax
 31535                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 31536                                  	mov	ax,[cs:bx]
 31537                                  
 31538                                  	;pop	ds
 31539                                  	;pop	si
 31540                                  	pop	bx
 31541                                  	retn
 31542                                  
 31543                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31544                                  ;*** StoLoadUMB - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 31545                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31546                                  ; ENTRY:   AL == new load UMB
 31547                                  ; EXIT:    None
 31548                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31549                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX
 31550                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31551                                  ; CAUTION: Should only be used if /L:... was used.  Logically, that is the only
 31552                                  ;          time you would ever need this, so that's okay.
 31553                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31554                                  
 31555                                  ;StoLoadUMB:
 31556                                  ;	;putdata UmbLoad, al
 31557                                  ;	push	es
 31558                                  ;	push	cs
 31559                                  ;	pop	es
 31560                                  ;	mov	[es:UmbLoad],al
 31561                                  ;	pop	es
 31562                                  ;	retn
 31563                                  
 31564                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31565                                  ;*** StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 31566                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31567                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == new load size
 31568                                  ; EXIT:   None
 31569                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31570                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31571                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31572                                  
 31573                                  StoLoadSize:
 31574                                  	push	dx
 31575                                  
 31576                                  	;getdata dl, UmbLoad		; Put UMB# in DL and size in AX
 31577                                  	;
 31578                                  	;push	ds
 31579                                  	;push	cs
 31580                                  	;pop	ds
 31581                                  	;mov	dl,[UmbLoad]
 31582                                  	;pop	ds	
 31583                                  
 31584                                  	mov	dl,[cs:UmbLoad]
 31585                                  
 31586                                  	cmp	dl,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 31587                                  	je	short sls10
 31588                                  
 31589                                  	call	stowSiz			; We've got a function to do just this
 31590                                  sls10:	
 31591                                  	pop	dx
 31592                                  	retn
 31593                                  
 31594                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31595                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 31596                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31597                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 31598                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 31599                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31600                                  ; USES:     Flags
 31601                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31602                                  
 31603                                  hideUMB:
 31604                                  	push	ax
 31605                                  	push	es
 31606                                  
 31607                                  	call	findUMB		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 31608                                  	jc	short huX
 31609                                  
 31610                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31611                                  ; HU10--ES - MCB inside UMB; if it's a system MCB,
 31612                                  ;            we're not in the same UMB, so exit.
 31613                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31614                                  
 31615                                  hu10:	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 31616                                  	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 31617                                  	;call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 31618                                  	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 31619                                  	jnz	short hu20
 31620                                  
 31621                                  	call	hideMCB
 31622                                  hu20:	
 31623                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31624                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ;'Z'
 31625                                  	jz	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31626                                  
 31627                                  	;NextMCB es, ax		; Go on forward.
 31628                                  	mov     ax,es
 31629                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 31630                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31631                                  	inc     ax
 31632                                  	mov     es,ax
 31633                                  
 31634                                  	jmp	short hu10
 31635                                  huX:	
 31636                                  	pop	es
 31637                                  	pop	ax
 31638                                  	retn
 31639                                  
 31640                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31641                                  ;*** isTiny - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S
 31642                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31643                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31644                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if user DIDN'T specify /S
 31645                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31646                                  ; USES:     Flags
 31647                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31648                                  
 31649                                  isTiny:
 31650                                  	push	ax
 31651                                  
 31652                                  	;getdata al, fUmbTiny
 31653                                  	;
 31654                                  	;push	ds
 31655                                  	;push	cs
 31656                                  	;pop	ds
 31657                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny]
 31658                                  	;pop	ds
 31659                                  
 31660                                  	mov	al,[cs:fUmbTiny]		
 31661                                  
 31662                                  	or	al,al
 31663                                  	pop	ax
 31664                                  	retn
 31665                                  
 31666                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31667                                  ;*** isFreeMCB - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FREE
 31668                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31669                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 31670                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if MCB is free, else !ZF
 31671                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31672                                  ; USES:     Flags
 31673                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31674                                  
 31675                                  ;isFreeMCB:
 31676                                  ;	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 31677                                  ;	retn
 31678                                  
 31679                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31680                                  ;*** hideMCB - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 31681                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31682                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 31683                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as HIDDEN
 31684                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31685                                  ; USES:     None
 31686                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31687                                  
 31688                                  hideMCB:
 31689                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8
 31690                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+0], 'HI' ; 4948h
 31691                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+2], 'DD' ; 4444h
 31692                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+4], 'EN' ; 4E45h
 31693                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+6], '  ' ; 2020h	
 31694                                  	retn
 31695                                  
 31696                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31697                                  ;*** unHideMCB - marks as FREE the MCB at ES:0
 31698                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31699                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 31700                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as FREE
 31701                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31702                                  ; USES:     None
 31703                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31704                                  
 31705                                  unHideMCB:
 31706                                  	push	ax
 31707                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],FreePSPOwner ; 0
 31708                                  	mov	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 31709                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+0],ax
 31710                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax
 31711                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax
 31712                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax
 31713                                  	pop	ax
 31714                                  	retn
 31715                                  
 31716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31717                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 31718                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 31719                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
